story:
Our Story

*****IF WE DON'T RAISE ENOUGH MONEY TO MAKE THE SHOES. YOU WILL GET A REFUND!!!*******
So for years and years, I wore Chucks. When I was in high school you could pick them up at the mall for 20 something bucks. For a long time they were considered "alternative" to other over priced, over hyped, over padded sneakers with springs and pumps made by giant blood sucking corporations. So all us "alternative kids" wore them while we checked our pagers and updated our live journals. Not long after in 2003, one of the big blood sucking corporations bought out the slightly less big less blood sucking corporation that made Chucks and immediately jacked up the price to $45. LAME! I just started wearing the more expensive leather version because they lasted longer and the canvas version didn't seem worth the price anymore. Fast forward to 2012, I was broke but I needed an extra pair of shoes for work. I didn't want to buy the expensive leather ones because my job wore the soles out too fast. That's when I realized the canvas shoes were now $55. TOO FAR! TOO FAR! I remembered that some stores had canvas sneakers that looked exactly like Chucks for way less money. I went around trying to find them. Everywhere I went were either out of them, didn't have my size, didn't have men's, only had lo-tops, etc. I tried to find some online, but they didn't have brand names. You can't just google "cheap fake Chucks" and find them. So I thought "I'll make them! I'll make canvas sneakers with their own brand name (which could be yours!) and logo that you can buy online. They'll be just like Chucks, only cheaper!"


Our Shoes

Our shoes are exactly what they look like. Classic style canvas sneakers that are a lot like Chucks, only cheaper. Sorry, they aren't vegan, organic, modern, political, or washed in unicorn tears. Those shoes are all over shitstarter, and good on them. I really just wanted shoes like the ones I already wear, only cheaper.


If you've worn Chucks and can relate to my story, these really are the shoes for you. I swear your feet won't know the difference. They have all the same qualities of those other shoes, only cheaper.

Form fitting and light weight. Basically a sock with a sole. Break 'em in and they mold to your foot. Genius! It's really why this style of shoe has lasted through the decades.

That's it! That's all I'm gonna say about them. There's no scientific breakthroughs in orthopedics or space age materials to explain to you. They're a classic style, only cheaper. Either you've worn this type of shoe before and you completely get it, or not. If not, I have nothing else I can say. Companies have been making rubber shoes with canvas uppers that look and feel like this since 1915, even before Chucks. If you haven't gotten into them yet, I can't help you.


Details

We're starting things of with the most popular style, black on white hi-tops. It would have been to hard to meet our goal if we needed to make more than that. We need to make goal in order to make the minimum amount to justify production. If we make goal, we'll add stretch goals with more colors in order of popularity. If we're successful and you guys really like our shoes, we'll go into full production with 8 core colors (think the small box of crayons you get made fun of for having by the spoiled brat with huge box of 128 colors) and season colors. Also lo-top and boot-top. In the mean time, think black and white. It goes with everything

Our Name

Our company name is *OnlyCheaper because we make shoes that are just like the other guy's*...*only cheaper. Our shoe is the John Doe Asterisk. John Doe is just a place holder until I get a basketball player who's name isn't Chuck Taylor or someone pledges 10 grand. Asterisk because of that whole little thing I just did up there with the asterisks and the company name. And because they aren't all stars, they're asterisks. Asterisks look kinda like stars...blah blah blah. IT'S CUTE AND YOU LOVE IT!


THAT'S IT!

I can't stress how simple of a concept this is. I have nothing else to say. Now give me your money so I can make you some shoes.

Risks and challenges

I mean, I've never really made shoes before. I mean I put some tissue boxes on my feet and walked around before, but that doesn't count. Once made these shoes will have to go on a boat, a train, and a truck to me so I can wrap them up and send them to you. So there are some things that can go wrong and get delayed in that process. I will always keep you updated. I have complete trust in our manufacturing partner and I am confident we can deliver. If any thing does go wrong, I have back up options for manufacturing. You will get shoes.

story:
Final Week!

Our campaign is in the home stretch! We're blown away by the generosity and support from everyone who has contributed. To thank you, and make one final push, we've designed an additional 12" X 12" screen print that we are giving to everyone that has backed us if we can get past the $5,000 mark. So spread the word one last time and help us go out with a bang.

 

The World Needs More Bombs.

There's a lot of bad in the world, but it doesn’t stand a chance against the power of good. We want to give the good a little extra oomph by hijacking a symbol of conflict, war, terror, pain and destruction and turning it into a beacon of cooperation, peace, love, hope and change. Let's make the world a happier place, one bomb at a time.

 

What We Do:

We make t-shirts (and stickers and prints). We think our designs make a statement about who you are and what you believe in. They also say you look awesome and have impeccable taste. So, it's pretty much the total package. 

Here are a few of the HappyBombs we’ve already designed that represent causes we plan to support in our inaugural year:

The Original HappyBomb line:

 The WaterBomb line:

The DropletBomb line:

 The PencilBomb line:

 

How It Works:

Step one: We identify a worthy cause.

Step two: We design a HappyBomb inspired by that cause.

Step three: We give half the profits to an innovative charity dedicated to that cause.

To start out, every month we will be supporting a different cause by launching a new line of HappyBombs (T-shirts, stickers, prints) inspired by their mission. Then using our social channels, we will dedicate the entire month to raising awareness and hopefully money to support their work.

 

What We Believe:

We believe in sharing. That's why our plan to open up our design process to anyone who wants to be involved. If you submit a design and we use it, you'll get full credit on our site, a link back to your portfolio and a share from our portion of the profits. If all goes according to plan (twists his mustache), there will be plenty to go around.

We believe in the power of positivity. Every action we take and decision we make will be positive. That means, whenever possible, we will work with socially conscious companies like Social Imprints who use environmentally friendly materials and printing practices. And of course, all our products will be made right here in the USA. 

We believe in aid not ads. To ensure that we are giving as much as we possibly can to every cause, we will not be paying for media. Instead, we will be relying on the power of social media and (fingers crossed) the passion of our supporters to spread the word.

 

Who We Are:

We used to work together at an advertising agency in Boston. We spent our days (and nights) thinking up new ways to build our clients’ businesses. It was fun. And we were good at it. But we felt like something was missing. Then it clicked. We realized all of our time and energy was being devoted to building their dreams, not ours. 

And Boom. HappyBombs was born.

Okay, so it wasn’t that simple. We’ve actually spent many nights and weekends over the last three years talking, researching, designing, refining, finding a printer, finding the perfect t-shirt, filling out paperwork, building a website, more refining, more designing and here we are. Locked, loaded, and ready to launch this company. Almost.

 

Why We're Here:

To bring HappyBombs to life we are going to need a little help. A little more help we should say, since we’ve gotten some amazing contributions from our friends along the way. But to make this dream a reality, we need to raise some money. And that is why we're on Indiegogo. 

Our goal is to raise enough money to fund our first three months of printing. This will include printing some of the HappyBomb lines mentioned above and printing a run of stickers. 

Hopefully after a few months we will be a household name (dream big, right?) and we can start printing multiple shirts, stickers, and posters for every cause. But in the event we don’t blow-up over night (yeah, we said it), any amount we raise beyond our initial goal will simply go toward printing additional lines of HappyBombs. The more support we get, the more we can make. 

If you are generous enough to back us, here are some of the exclusive perks you'll receive:


 

Who Deserves A Shout-out:

Neil Cleary - For an incredible music track.

Brian Riccio - For spending many late nights animating our video.

Phil Davis, Dave Caron, Dave Blank, Jeff Langevin and Mark LaRosa - For donating your design talents and helping us define our look. 

Kevin McCracken and Daniel Phifer [from Social Imprints] - For being patient and helpful printing partners, working with us to make this happen.

 

Challenges And Risks:

As we see it, the biggest challenge ahead for this project is going to be spreading the word about HappyBombs. Luckily, that's what we do for a living. So we're actually pretty excited to get to work.

Our biggest risk would probably be our name. We are fueled by the notion of turning negatives into positives. And while we acknowledge that some people might not get that right away, it's a risk we're happy to take.

#BoomGoesTheHappy

story:
Note: This platform will be in English, French, German, spain, Italian, Russian and Chinese

A research platform on design

 Hi, I'm Blue Eve! 

Ever since my mom's dream of me becoming a lawyer fell through, I spend most of my time reading, searching and writting some articles. 

As some of you know a lot about design, I’m not gonna waste your time. But, need your help for the project named Exility Design, a research platform on design with a real demand ! it a collection of data on design for academics, students, opinion leaders… 

it's about creative design process!

Check out this video by BMW... it's not only a really nice car, it's about reflection, ideas, work, creativity... http://youtu.be/kTYiEkQYhWY

 

I'm developping a research platform on design (with your help)!

Exility Design is a research support, observation of design and all its applications: Art, Architecture, furniture, decoration, motors ... to foster learning and fun. It will be the benchmark of international design. This will allow the centralization of knowledge, skills and tools for creating the design through contemporary design news, articles, news items, studies, analysis, in-depth reflection, specialists’ intervention, videos, interviews, photos, audio.

The objective is to create an online database, a source of inspiration and knowledge, in an accessible format in which contemporary art, design and architecture meet. Architecture in which dissolves in design, visual arts are diluted in fashion, styling blends with the decor. If we can raise the money, this platform will only take 6 months of dedicated development to get into everyone's hands.

"Why is Exility Design platform Now?"

It's something I've always wanted to do! I love research, publication and especially share ideas, my treasure and if I could get together with researchers and opinion leaders to make this project real, I think we could make something good to support a real need !

I get bored really easily, so trust me, this platform is gonna have to be awesome!

It takes more than just an idea to create something as epic as Exility Design. There are the website developers, graphic artists, journalists... and that's just to name a few.

 

We Need Your Help! 

Every penny donated (after covering the awesome donation perks, etc) will go toward the production of this, and FUTURE publications. The publication will begin as soon as funds start coming in. If we're able to surpass our goal, I can finish the website and start video production…

The more we make, the more we CAN make.The goal is to always have something in the works to give back to the Audience.

 

GET  COOL STUFF ... SPREAD THE WORD!!!

All you have to do is share using the "Share This Campaign" link above and post it every where so your friends can check out the project and get in on the action. 

  

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute? That doesn't mean you can't help take back the media!

Spread the word, tell your social network on Facebook. We're going to need as many people as possible to help out if we are going to meet our goal.

story:
Hello fellow artists! Thank you so much for checking out this campaign.

Would you like a place to create art alongside others that will not only help you in the development of your craft, but potentially get you work and advance your career?

Or, are you someone that would like to explore a creative field in movie making but have no means to do so?

We stand ready to create this place for you! Where artists can create whenever they want, without restriction, in a community of other enthusiastic artists.

With the Internet we have only begun to skim the surface of what collaborative art can be about!

And, with MoviesIndeed.com, we are taking a big step toward what is actually possible. Please consider contributing to this project and join us in creating a format that give artists more control over their own careers.

Contact us with any questions about this project at buzz@moviesindeed.com.

Be sure to sign up to our mailing list at: www.moviesindeed.com/crowdfunding

Now Hiring: www.moviesindeed.com/hiring

Please fill out an online application at the URL above and be a part of the original crew that creates the first fully produced feature off the site! We need writers, actors, musicians, foley artists, sound designers and illustrators.

This project is multifaceted.

First, it is to complete the collaborative art website, MoviesIndeed.com, which stands at about 60% complete right now. This site will provide a platform for anyone to work on movie or TV scripts right from their home. Activities include writing, acting, sound effect and soundtrack production, storyboard illustration and audience participation.

Second, the funding includes the hiring of talent to create the first few scripts. I want to hire as many artists as we can and continue to employ artists even after the initial scripts on the site are completed.

Finally, the project includes the actual production of the first completed script off the site. This script (or scripts if we receive more funding) will be written by the people hired.

How big we start off completely depends on YOU! The more funding we receive the more artists we can hire and the more scripts we can get produced!

Networking

As anyone in the industry will tell you, “It's who you know”. Of course it is! Networking on the site happens in many ways, from meeting through working on scripts, to live and forum chats, to messaging. An online contact book will be provided so you don't lose track of people.

Groups and Troupes

We can expect that people will gravitate towards working with people they've enjoyed working with in the past. We will give you the ability to form named groups, whether it be writers, actors, or a mix of different artists (a production company). Projects can be created and completed by groups rather than by individuals.

Feedback

You get feedback only when you request it. Feedback is given in response to a question you pose.

“I wanted to foreshadow the next scene with this sound clip, is that the mood you wanted to capture?”

“Which of these performances do you prefer?” (You will have the ability to upload more than one version of something)

“Do like this style of writing or this one for this scene?”

"What are your impressions of this performance?" etc.

Additionally, you have the choice as to WHO you want to ask. Specific friends? Members of your group/troupe? Members of the script you're working on? Or, brave soul, the audience?

Of course, when you receive applause from the audience for your work, this also gives you feedback on what you're doing.

The final method of getting feedback is by private mentor. See the educational section on this.

Basic, Advanced and Professional Sections

The Basic section is for novices or people wanting to dabble in the creative process. You can create alias accounts for this purpose so you can explore or experiment aside from your main account. With the Basic section you can explore creative areas it would have been difficult to get into before.

The Advanced section is for people who really want to put their best effort into making scripts and script productions. Everyone is expected to complete their tasks in a timely manner. The head writer has the ability to suspend users should they suddenly become absent.

Both the Basic and Advanced sections are free of charge to users.

The Professional section is a 'private studio' for those wanting to collaborate with others in some fashion, whether it be with other writers and artists or with a private screening audience.

This is a paid section of the site and is completely secure and private.

Fans and Applause

Applause is achieved after something you've created is published on the site, whether it be an acting file, clip of a soundtrack, illustration, etc. The amount of total applause you've received is shown on your profile page. It is also computed with experience, number of winning votes and amount of fans to give you an overall 'Star Rating'. See Star Rating.

Your fans are those who actively follow you. It's not a permanent status achieved by someone clicking to become your fan one time. If a fan hasn't followed your last few works, they are dropped as a fan. Because of this, when you tell agents, managers and producers your Fan Number, they will know that these fans are very much participating in what you do online.

Education

An integral part of the financial success of the site will be providing educational opportunities. Not only will this bring in revenue, but by helping artists grow and get work we are building alliances.

Plans for education and mentoring are:

·Online webinars with A-list professionals in the industry. Online webinars are great because you get live training with a Hollywood insider but at a very affordable cost. In a webinar, you are free to get all your questions answered and get information you would be hard pressed to get any other way. We already have one 20-year writing veteran, Stephanie Phillips, on board to deliver webinars covering topics, such as: Turning Your Idea into an Outline, Advanced Screenwriting, and Learning How to Pitch. We will also seek out other accomplished and well-known artists. Imagine that, even if you’re living in a small town in Indiana, that you can get acting tips from someone you've only seen on TV or in the movies. I want to bring this to you!

·Private, one-on-one mentoring with a pro of your choice. For the student, this provides the best form of education: the private mentor. For the educator, this provides an opportunity to make money helping others. This person can follow you on your scripts, join you in private scripts, you can assist them on script by providing feedback, etc. In order to become a private mentor you must have achieved good success in your field and provide an excellent resume.

·Live group writing sessions is where you and a few other writers join a professional writer to create a script. It is on-the-job-training to the extreme. Each writer will submit scenes inside a private forum and the pro writer will decide on the winning scene, of course, providing feedback. The pro writer will suggest courses of action and offer advice along the way. There is nothing like writing and getting immediate feedback from a pro to learn the art of writing! And, if the script is of good quality Stephanie can submit it to agents and producers. Imagine getting a great education and at the same time have the potential for the script that is produced getting optioned! You're not going to get this possibility within a traditional classroom setting!

The Star Rating System

There will be different, achievable levels for any role, even audience members. Beside your name are icons, one for each artistic field you engage in. These icons change color based on your level of 'expertise', or 'Stardom'

Levels of Expertise/Stardom are based on different elements:

·Experience: Most of your overall Star Rating is attributed to how much experience you have in that area on the site. The backbone of everything, from artistic development to site success, is based how much you actually do. So, this will have the greatest impact on your Star Status/Expertise Level.

·Applause Credits: Anything that you upload onto the site can receive applause. This counts towards your score

·Winning submissions: if you work as a writer, the number of winning scenes counts towards your Star Rating.

·Audience Voting: credits for voting elevate your status as an audience member. Different levels carry different weight. If you have achieved a high status as an audience member, your vote could count as 2, 3, 4 etc., votes. In order to be paid royalties as an Audience member you need to achieve a particular level.

·Other elements can affect the rating, like number of fans, winning awards at the Annual Awards ceremony, scripts that get picked up or produced, etc.

50 Script Launch

50 scripts...that sounds ambitious!

What is life without a little ambition? The goal of 50 scripts is an ideal, but adequate funds would be needed to hire staff sufficient to fully create that many scripts. Also, all scripts wouldn't need to be full-feature productions. There can be trailers, short scripts, etc.

The first goal of the site is to get a script produced by a local theatrical company here in Los Angeles. As one of the goals for users of the site is to get their work picked up and produced, we need to make the first goal of the site the production of a script. In this way we all have a real product in our hands, which provides inspiration.

Of course, the more scripts we have to choose from to produce the better our chances of getting a great production.

We will create special function on the site for the sole purpose of getting that first great script.

We can start the site with 50 script ideas very easily, hiring 25 writers to write 50 loglines, hiring 50 writers to write one, etc. From there we will have people vote on their favorite ideas, which will make it to the second level of actually getting started writing and online production. For example, out of the first 50 script ideas we may narrow that down to the top 25 ideas and then we may have the first 5 scenes made on these. Out of these 25 we may narrow it down to 10 and then get these through the first or second acts. Then out of these 10, after the first or second act, we may narrow that down to the top 3. These may get fully produced on-site, with the community voting on which will make it to off-site, full video production. With sufficient budget we could get more than one produced.

We will have consultants who monitor the scripts and offer estimates on the costs of producing a scene/script so that we can keep the writing in line with the actual budget.

The details above are not set in stone right now and are mostly dependent on budgetary restrictions. We can do a lot more with $1,000,000 than with $125,000, of course!

Different options could include, but are not limited to:

·one Flagship production (a must)

·one low-budget theatrical production

·a one-man stage production

Not all productions have to cost a lot of money. Casa 0101, for example, is a company that specializes in helping writers of all different financial backgrounds. A low-budget production of a stage script could only cost $1,000. This type of production isn't done to try to pack theaters across the county, but to give writers and artists inspiration to see their work actually produced. To hear one's words spoken on a live stage provides a great reward to writers as well as inspiration to the entire community.

Will your script be next?

I would like to see scripts get produced regularly off the site. We could have a quarterly 'winning scripts' that gets voted for production.

My vision is that production companies all over the world can bid on projects. The flow could be:

Every 3 months scripts of various nature are voted upon to get produced. Production companies bid on the projects. You can see reels of other works produced by these companies on the site. The community votes on which bid to accept. After a winning bid is accepted we go into a funding period. This can be done on Indiegogo.com. Upon funding the production company is placed on a schedule to get production completed in a timely manner. Updates to users are required.

A Strict, User-Enforced, No-Negativity Policy

Because creativity flourishes best in a positive, supportive environment, we will create a strict, no-negativity policy that is enforced by users. If you leave a comment that is deemed as ‘not constructive’, other users can flag it. After a certain amount of flags the comment will automatically be removed.

Feedback is only given if it was requested by the artist. If comments are given without request, aside from wholly positive ones, the comment would be removed. If feedback is requested, then your comments should be made in a constructive manner. If you don’t know how to make constructive comments, well, you will learn very quickly! :)

Anyone continually getting flagged for violating the policy can have their account suspended. I don’t anticipate that people will be abusing this policy, however.

Promotion Via MoviesIndeed.com

There will be many opportunities for you to promote yourself and your art via the site. For everything you publish on the site, links will be provided not only to your MoviesIndeed profile but also off-site links to hire you, buy your art/music, speak to you about private lessons, etc.

For example, maybe you have a great band and want to promote your music. You can use your band’s music as the basis of a soundtrack. Links can be provided alongside your soundtrack directly to a site where people can buy your music.

I also plan to draw an alliance with a freelance site like elance.com, odesk.com, freelancer.com. I've hired hundreds of people over the years through these sites. Let's say you're an illustrator, you can have an account at one of these sites with a link to hire you, connected to every illustration you upload.

Script Submission Service

We can have Stephanie Phillips, our professional staff writer, evaluate your privately written script and, if it is of sufficient caliber, have it submitted to agents, managers and producers. Know that we will only take scripts that she feels has a 'shot'. This will not be a service where we take a script, charge you a fee and mail it out. You would need to have your script evaluated and only those that Stephanie feels are of high caliber will be circulated. Stephanie has many contacts in the industry and needs to maintain a reputation, so when she presents a script to someone they will know it's going to be strong.

Other Site Functions To Add:

·A rating system: do you want your script to be G, PG, R, etc.?

·How long do you want a script to be? A 5 min stage production? A 2 min movie trailer? 30 min TV show? A full 90 min feature?

·A platform for different musicians to contribute to a soundtrack. For example, a guitarist uploads a musical segment, timed with a click, which is downloaded by a bass player and bongo player who each adds their parts. The click is taken off and the final product is uploaded to the script. Of course it’s usually best to lay down percussion first for a final track, so the coordination of moving beyond a scratch track is up to the musicians.

·Alongside the logline is a listing of positions needed to fill the script, like 'Foley Artist Needed'. Also listed is the current completion level.

·Upgrade the messaging system so that people can send bulk messages to specific categories of artists. For example, you need an illustrator, so you send a message to all illustrators (who agree to accept bulk messages) asking for someone to join your script

·Input a partially completed script, inviting others to continue from the point you left off.

Did you read all of this? Dang you are interested! The only things left to do are make a contribution and tell your friends. :)

See you soon!

Much love,

Jake Sherwood Fannin
story_txt:
Hello fellow artists! Thank you so much for checking out this campaign.
Would you like a place to create art alongside others that will not only help you in the development of your craft, but potentially get you work and advance your career?
Or, are you someone that would like to explore a creative field in movie making but have no means to do so?
We stand ready to create this place for you! Where artists can create whenever they want, without restriction, in a community of other enthusiastic artists.
With the Internet we have only begun to skim the surface of what collaborative art can be about!
And, with MoviesIndeed.com, we are taking a big step toward what is actually possible. Please consider contributing to this project and join us in creating a format that give artists more control over their own careers.
Contact us with any questions about this project at buzz@moviesindeed.com.
Be sure to sign up to our mailing list at: www.moviesindeed.com/crowdfunding
Now Hiring: www.moviesindeed.com/hiring
Please fill out an online application at the URL above and be a part of the original crew that creates the first fully produced feature off the site! We need writers, actors, musicians, foley artists, sound designers and illustrators.
This project is multifaceted.
First, it is to complete the collaborative art website, MoviesIndeed.com, which stands at about 60% complete right now. This site will provide a platform for anyone to work on movie or TV scripts right from their home. Activities include writing, acting, sound effect and soundtrack production, storyboard illustration and audience participation.
Second, the funding includes the hiring of talent to create the first few scripts. I want to hire as many artists as we can and continue to employ artists even after the initial scripts on the site are completed.
Finally, the project includes the actual production of the first completed script off the site. This script (or scripts if we receive more funding) will be written by the people hired.
How big we start off completely depends on YOU! The more funding we receive the more artists we can hire and the more scripts we can get produced!
Networking
As anyone in the industry will tell you, “It's who you know”. Of course it is! Networking on the site happens in many ways, from meeting through working on scripts, to live and forum chats, to messaging. An online contact book will be provided so you don't lose track of people.
Groups and Troupes
We can expect that people will gravitate towards working with people they've enjoyed working with in the past. We will give you the ability to form named groups, whether it be writers, actors, or a mix of different artists (a production company). Projects can be created and completed by groups rather than by individuals.
Feedback
You get feedback only when you request it. Feedback is given in response to a question you pose.
“I wanted to foreshadow the next scene with this sound clip, is that the mood you wanted to capture?”
“Which of these performances do you prefer?” (You will have the ability to upload more than one version of something)
“Do like this style of writing or this one for this scene?”
"What are your impressions of this performance?" etc.
Additionally, you have the choice as to WHO you want to ask. Specific friends? Members of your group/troupe? Members of the script you're working on? Or, brave soul, the audience?
Of course, when you receive applause from the audience for your work, this also gives you feedback on what you're doing.
The final method of getting feedback is by private mentor. See the educational section on this.
Basic, Advanced and Professional Sections
The Basic section is for novices or people wanting to dabble in the creative process. You can create alias accounts for this purpose so you can explore or experiment aside from your main account. With the Basic section you can explore creative areas it would have been difficult to get into before.
The Advanced section is for people who really want to put their best effort into making scripts and script productions. Everyone is expected to complete their tasks in a timely manner. The head writer has the ability to suspend users should they suddenly become absent.
Both the Basic and Advanced sections are free of charge to users.
The Professional section is a 'private studio' for those wanting to collaborate with others in some fashion, whether it be with other writers and artists or with a private screening audience.
This is a paid section of the site and is completely secure and private.
Fans and Applause
Applause is achieved after something you've created is published on the site, whether it be an acting file, clip of a soundtrack, illustration, etc. The amount of total applause you've received is shown on your profile page. It is also computed with experience, number of winning votes and amount of fans to give you an overall 'Star Rating'. See Star Rating.
Your fans are those who actively follow you. It's not a permanent status achieved by someone clicking to become your fan one time. If a fan hasn't followed your last few works, they are dropped as a fan. Because of this, when you tell agents, managers and producers your Fan Number, they will know that these fans are very much participating in what you do online.
Education
An integral part of the financial success of the site will be providing educational opportunities. Not only will this bring in revenue, but by helping artists grow and get work we are building alliances.
Plans for education and mentoring are:
·Online webinars with A-list professionals in the industry. Online webinars are great because you get live training with a Hollywood insider but at a very affordable cost. In a webinar, you are free to get all your questions answered and get information you would be hard pressed to get any other way. We already have one 20-year writing veteran, Stephanie Phillips, on board to deliver webinars covering topics, such as: Turning Your Idea into an Outline, Advanced Screenwriting, and Learning How to Pitch. We will also seek out other accomplished and well-known artists. Imagine that, even if you’re living in a small town in Indiana, that you can get acting tips from someone you've only seen on TV or in the movies. I want to bring this to you!
·Private, one-on-one mentoring with a pro of your choice. For the student, this provides the best form of education: the private mentor. For the educator, this provides an opportunity to make money helping others. This person can follow you on your scripts, join you in private scripts, you can assist them on script by providing feedback, etc. In order to become a private mentor you must have achieved good success in your field and provide an excellent resume.
·Live group writing sessions is where you and a few other writers join a professional writer to create a script. It is on-the-job-training to the extreme. Each writer will submit scenes inside a private forum and the pro writer will decide on the winning scene, of course, providing feedback. The pro writer will suggest courses of action and offer advice along the way. There is nothing like writing and getting immediate feedback from a pro to learn the art of writing! And, if the script is of good quality Stephanie can submit it to agents and producers. Imagine getting a great education and at the same time have the potential for the script that is produced getting optioned! You're not going to get this possibility within a traditional classroom setting!

story:
WE WILL PRINT SHIRTS REGARDLESS 

WE WILL PRINT SHIRTS REGARDLESS 

WE WILL PRINT SHIRTS REGARDLESS 

We are a group of Virginia Tech students who have been studying the effects of world events on the human population. One huge event that happened recently was Typhoon Haiyan in the Philippines. This natural disaster has taken over 5,000 lives and has injured well over 25,000 people and effected all 86,000 inhabitants of the Philippines. Please help us reach our goal. After raising $1000, we will be enabled to support survivors of Typhoon Haiyan through the Red Cross.

We are making t-shirts with an impactful design that is going to help benefit the people directly effected by Typhoon Haiyan in the Philippines. You can also select the 'Helping Hand' perk and donate money. 100% of donations go directly to Red Cross.

After contributing, please share this campaign with your friends and family to help spread the word about our work to aid the people of the Philippines. Through the Red Cross, your donations will be used to provide life essentials to the survivors of Typhoon Haiyan.


Email me at kyleh49@vt.edu if you have any questions

Shipping included in listed price. (Some exceptions ex. Shipping outside of continental U.S.)

story:
A QUICK SUMMARY

     For each of the last 4 years that I've participated in the breast cancer 3-Day for the Cure 60-mile walk events, I have successfully raised $2,300 to meet my goal. Woohoo!!

     But it's been tough...

     If you know me at all, you know that I HATE asking for money! I'm terrible at it.  It makes me anxious.  I know that I truly love and care about finding a cure for breast cancer, but I'm totally uncomfortable asking others to share this passion in a financial sense.

     So in 2012 I am trying to get off the begging band-wagon: I want to earn my donations.  My plan is to invest in a self-perpetuating fundraising model that will earn me money that I will put towards my yearly fundraising goal of $2,300...and hopefully my goal will increase each year as I sell more buttons!

     Rather than asking friends and family for another donation year after year, this year I am asking you for a one-time investment so that I can buy a button-making machine.  I will use the machine to make and sell custom breast cancer buttons for $3 each (or 2/$5) at nearby breast cancer events (Louisville, Lexington, Chicago, St. Louis, Atlanta, etc).  The funds I earn from the sale of these buttons will go towards my participation in the Susan G. Komen 3-Day for the Cure.  


     Interested? See the Perk Levels to the right to help get me started!

 

THINK PINK

     Breast cancer awareness fundraising events are held each year all around the country…if you’ve never experienced the pink craziness of a breast cancer event (walk, ride, run, etc) before, well, you might not understand what I mean by “craziness.” 

     Close your eyes and imagine pink as far as the eye can see.  Pink pom-poms.  Women wearing bras on top of their t-shirts.  Heck, even MEN wearing bras on top of their t-shirts!  Let’s be honest here, we all love boobs. :)

Pink as far as the eye can see...

OK so maybe it’s not your cup of tea, but I assure you, it’s an amazing emotional experience you should try at least once in your life.  This will be my fifth year walking for the cure in various events across the nation (I’ve walked 60 miles in the Susan G. Komen 3-Day for the Cure in Atlanta, San Francisco, Dallas and Tampa Bay)

     And this year I’ve decided to “cash in” on all that boobie hoopla and set myself up a lemonade-stand style table at events where I’m not participating and sell breast cancer related merchandise to the walkers and supporters. 

 

THE IDEA

In my years as an event participant, I’ve learned two things:

     1. Supporters (walkers, family, friends) are fanatical (read: emotional) about the cure

     2. Walkers young and old all LOVE breast cancer awareness merchandise

Me and my walkin' buddies

These two things combined led me to a business opportunity…because participants on-site at these events will spend money on unique items to add to their pink collection. 

     I know this because I am one of those fanatics!  I’ve racked up quite a collection of scarves, hats, socks, animals, jewelry, and most importantly…BUTTONS!  My plan is to make and sell unique pin-back buttons that speak to attendees at these events.  Anybody from breast cancer survivors to husbands/family/friends/supporters of somebody special battling this terrible disease will find a button that speaks to them. 

 

THE PLAN

I have two main goals for my button project:

     1. Create smiles by offering the perfect breast cancer message

     2. Sell unique buttons like gangbusters!

     Starting summer 2012, I will become the breast-cancer-awareness-button-maker-extraordinaire.  I have researched the costs for a complete button making machine and supplies, created over 60 button designs, and chosen six breast cancer events in and around my home city to travel to and sell these buttons. 

     Buttons will be sold in a simple setup similar to a lemonade stand: table and chairs, posters for display, radio with high energy playlist, and candy/snacks for the walkers.  The pricing of the buttons will be comparable (actually cheaper) to breast cancer buttons sold online: 1 button for $3, 4 buttons for $10.  I anticipate that most buttons will be sold in bulk groups for an average price of $2.50 each.

     All that’s left for me to get started is the equipment! With full funding, I will have the ability to make and sell 1,000 buttons at breast cancer events between July and November.

 

THE COSTS FOR 1,000 BUTTONS:

  •     Button maker: $200.00
  •     Button supplies: $88.00
  •     Shipping: $65.00
  •     Circle punch: $127.00
  •     Printing: $70.00

 

THE EVENTS

 

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Q: “Can we exceed our goal?”

            A: YES! This would be incredible! Indiegogo will allow me to keep as much money as was given before the deadline.  The goal of $550 will cover the costs of the super-duper-button-making-machine and the parts and pieces to make 1,000 buttons. With additional funding I will be able to a) pay for travel expenses to get to the six events, b) make more than 1,000 buttons, and maybe c) travel to more than six events.   

Q: “What happens if we don’t reach our goal?”

            A: If our goal isn’t met before the deadline, your card isn’t charged, and I'm on my own to accomplish what I've set out here.  I’ve already designed the buttons, created organizer bins to hold my wares, compiled the ‘high energy music playlist’ for event days, and invested in 12 pounds of pink lemonade drink powder to quench participants’ thirst.  I’m so ready – this button-making is going to happen.  Without your help I’ll just have to break into my piggy bank to buy the machine myself.  It won't be the end of the world but let's avoid that, shall we?

Q: “If I can't give a cash donation, are there other ways that I can support your project?”

            A:You bet!  What I most need are cash donations (of any size, big or small), but if you have some creative design ideas and want to share them with me so that I can add them to my design portfolio and use to sell more buttons, that would be great!  I would also appreciate if you would share this campaign with others who would be interested to buy a breast cancer button and/or support in another way.  I really need your help and anything you can offer will be greatly appreciated!

 

 Q: “Is my pledge amount publicly displayed?”

            A: You can choose whether or not you want your name and contribution amount to be displayed on the campaign page under the Funders tab. Choose “Visible" if you want both your name and amount displayed, “Identity-Only” if you want only your name displayed without your amount, and “Anonymous” if you want only your amount displayed.

 Q: “What if I don’t want the reward, I just want to support your project?”

            A: There is an option you can select if you don’t want the reward…no problem.

Q: “What is your affiliation with breast cancer fundraising groups?”

            A: I want to see an end to breast cancer, period.  There are many, many worthy fundraising organizations who are working to find the cure and I suggest you do your research if you wish to support one of these organizations directly.  I personally love the Breast Cancer 3-Day events for their intensity and camaraderie.  Plus walking 60 miles in 3 days is hella fun. :)

 Q: “I don’t like boobs so why should I support your project?”

            A: Don't lie, everybody likes boobs. 

Q: “Can I give my reward buttons to someone else as a gift?”

            A: Sure, why not? If you would like to support the Buttons for Boobies Project but give your reward to someone as a gift, go through the normal process of making a donation in your name. For billing purposes, this action must be in your name. After our deadline, we will send a message to you through Indiegogo. (It will be forwarded to the email address you provided). We will request things like your custom design or message for buttons and address from you at that time. If you’re giving your reward as a gift and would like it to be mailed directly to him/her, simply include the recipient’s information (and any note you’d like to include). We’ll make sure this special person in your life gets it.

Q: “Can I increase my pledge once it’s been made?

            A: YES! Once you back our campaign with a pledge amount, you may want to change your reward to a different one, or increase your pledge amount.  Check out the Indiegogo Help Center forum "How to Upgrade Your Perk" through the following link:

http://support.indiegogo.com/entries/20517401-h...

Q: “Who does the money go to?”

            A: Every penny (minus the fees for Indiegogo’s involvement) will go directly to the Buttons for Boobies budget – your money goes to the funding of this project to purchase the button maker machine and parts for 1,000 buttons.  With additional funding I will be able to a) pay for travel expenses to get to the six events, b) make more than 1,000 buttons, and maybe c) travel to more than six events.   

 Q: “Are those your real boobs in the video or did you use a breast double?”

            A: No comment.

Q: “I'm not in the US. Can I still pledge to projects?”

            A: Yes. You can pledge from anywhere.

Q: “Who is that stoic dog in the video?”

            A: He’s a pretty cool pup, right? It's Bailey, my adopted Black Labrador/Golden Retriever who flunked out of service dog school and now pays for his lavish ball-chasing lifestyle directing full-length films.  We were really excited to get on his busy schedule for this short clip. 

Bailey, the Service Dog Flunkie

Support this project or my friends from the San Jose Police bike squad will come get you... just kidding :)
story_txt:
A QUICK SUMMARY
     For each of the last 4 years that I've participated in the breast cancer 3-Day for the Cure 60-mile walk events, I have successfully raised $2,300 to meet my goal. Woohoo!!     But it's been tough...     If you know me at all, you know that I HATE asking for money! I'm terrible at it.  It makes me anxious.  I know that I truly love and care about finding a cure for breast cancer, but I'm totally uncomfortable asking others to share this passion in a financial sense.     So in 2012 I am trying to get off the begging band-wagon: I want to earn my donations.  My plan is to invest in a self-perpetuating fundraising model that will earn me money that I will put towards my yearly fundraising goal of $2,300...and hopefully my goal will increase each year as I sell more buttons!     Rather than asking friends and family for another donation year after year, this year I am asking you for a one-time investment so that I can buy a button-making machine.  I will use the machine to make and sell custom breast cancer buttons for $3 each (or 2/$5) at nearby breast cancer events (Louisville, Lexington, Chicago, St. Louis, Atlanta, etc).  The funds I earn from the sale of these buttons will go towards my participation in the Susan G. Komen 3-Day for the Cure.  
     Interested? See the Perk Levels to the right to help get me started!
 
THINK PINK
     Breast cancer awareness fundraising events are held each year all around the country…if you’ve never experienced the pink craziness of a breast cancer event (walk, ride, run, etc) before, well, you might not understand what I mean by “craziness.” 
     Close your eyes and imagine pink as far as the eye can see.  Pink pom-poms.  Women wearing bras on top of their t-shirts.  Heck, even MEN wearing bras on top of their t-shirts!  Let’s be honest here, we all love boobs. :)

Pink as far as the eye can see...
OK so maybe it’s not your cup of tea, but I assure you, it’s an amazing emotional experience you should try at least once in your life.  This will be my fifth year walking for the cure in various events across the nation (I’ve walked 60 miles in the Susan G. Komen 3-Day for the Cure in Atlanta, San Francisco, Dallas and Tampa Bay)
     And this year I’ve decided to “cash in” on all that boobie hoopla and set myself up a lemonade-stand style table at events where I’m not participating and sell breast cancer related merchandise to the walkers and supporters. 
 
THE IDEA 
In my years as an event participant, I’ve learned two things:
     1. Supporters (walkers, family, friends) are fanatical (read: emotional) about the cure
     2. Walkers young and old all LOVE breast cancer awareness merchandise

Me and my walkin' buddies
These two things combined led me to a business opportunity…because participants on-site at these events will spend money on unique items to add to their pink collection. 
     I know this because I am one of those fanatics!  I’ve racked up quite a collection of scarves, hats, socks, animals, jewelry, and most importantly…BUTTONS!  My plan is to make and sell unique pin-back buttons that speak to attendees at these events.  Anybody from breast cancer survivors to husbands/family/friends/supporters of somebody special battling this terrible disease will find a button that speaks to them. 

 
THE PLAN
I have two main goals for my button project:
     1. Create smiles by offering the perfect breast cancer message
     2. Sell unique buttons like gangbusters!
     Starting summer 2012, I will become the breast-cancer-awareness-button-maker-extraordinaire.  I have researched the costs for a complete button making machine and supplies, created over 60 button designs, and chosen six breast cancer events in and around my home city to travel to and sell these buttons. 
     Buttons will be sold in a simple setup similar to a lemonade stand: table and chairs, posters for display, radio with high energy playlist, and candy/snacks for the walkers.  The pricing of the buttons will be comparable (actually cheaper) to breast cancer buttons sold online: 1 button for $3, 4 buttons for $10.  I anticipate that most buttons will be sold in bulk groups for an average price of $2.50 each.
     All that’s left for me to get started is the equipment! With full funding, I will have the ability to make and sell 1,000 buttons at breast cancer events between July and November.
 
THE COSTS FOR 1,000 BUTTONS: 

    Button maker: $200.00
    Button supplies: $88.00
    Shipping: $65.00
    Circle punch: $127.00
    Printing: $70.00
 
THE EVENTS

 
FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS
Q: “Can we exceed our goal?”
            A: YES! This would be incredible! Indiegogo will allow me to keep as much money as was given before the deadline.  The goal of $550 will cover the costs of the super-duper-button-making-machine and the parts and pieces to make 1,000 buttons. With additional funding I will be able to a) pay for travel expenses to get to the six events, b) make more than 1,000 buttons, and maybe c) travel to more than six events.   
Q: “What happens if we don’t reach our goal?”
            A: If our goal isn’t met before the deadline, your card isn’t charged, and I'm on my own to accomplish what I've set out here.  I’ve already designed the buttons, created organizer bins to hold my wares, compiled the ‘high energy music playlist’ for event days, and invested in 12 pounds of pink lemonade drink powder to quench participants’ thirst.  I’m so ready – this button-making is going to happen.  Without your help I’ll just have to break into my piggy bank to buy the machine myself.  It won't be the end of the world but let's avoid that, shall we?
Q: “If I can't give a cash donation, are there other ways that I can support your project?”
            A:You bet!  What I most need are cash donations (of any size, big or small), but if you have some creative design ideas and want to share them with me so that I can add them to my design portfolio and use to sell more buttons, that would be great!  I would also appreciate if you would share this campaign with others who would be interested to buy a breast cancer button and/or support in another way.  I really need your help and anything you can offer will be greatly appreciated!
 
 Q: “Is my pledge amount publicly displayed?”
            A: You can choose whether or not you want your name and contribution amount to be displayed on the campaign page under the Funders tab. Choose “Visible" if you want both your name and amount displayed, “Identity-Only” if you want only your name displayed without your amount, and “Anonymous” if you want only your amount displayed. 
 Q: “What if I don’t want the reward, I just want to support your project?”
            A: There is an option you can select if you don’t want the reward…no problem.
Q: “What is your affiliation with breast cancer fundraising groups?”
            A: I want to see an end to breast cancer, period.  There are many, many worthy fundraising organizations who are working to find the cure and I suggest you do your research if you wish to support one of these organizations directly.  I personally love the Breast Cancer 3-Day events for their intensity and camaraderie.  Plus walking 60 miles in 3 days is hella fun. :)
 Q: “I don’t like boobs so why should I support your project?”
            A: Don't lie, everybody likes boobs. 
Q: “Can I give my reward buttons to someone else as a gift?”
            A: Sure, why not? If you would like to support the Buttons for Boobies Project but give your reward to someone as a gift, go through the normal process of making a donation in your name. For billing purposes, this action must be in your name. After our deadline, we will send a message to you through Indiegogo. (It will be forwarded to the email address you provided). We will request things like your custom design or message for buttons and address from you at that time. If you’re giving your reward as a gift and would like it to be mailed directly to him/her, simply include the recipient’s information (and any note you’d like to include). We’ll make sure this special person in your life gets it.
Q: “Can I increase my pledge once it’s been made? 
            A: YES! Once you back our campaign with a pledge amount, you may want to change your reward to a different one, or increase your pledge amount.  Check out the Indiegogo Help Center forum "How to Upgrade Your Perk" through the following link: 
http://support.indiegogo.com/entries/20517401-h...
Q: “Who does the money go to?”
            A: Every penny (minus the fees for Indiegogo’s involvement) will go directly to the Buttons for Boobies budget – your money goes to the funding of this project to purchase the button maker machine and parts for 1,000 buttons.  With additional funding I will be able to a) pay for travel expenses to get to the six events, b) make more than 1,000 buttons, and maybe c) travel to more than six events.   
 Q: “Are those your real boobs in the video or did you use a breast double?”
            A: No comment.Q: “I'm not in the US. Can I still pledge to projects?”
            A: Yes. You can pledge from anywhere.
Q: “Who is that stoic dog in the video?”
            A: He’s a pretty cool pup, right? It's Bailey, my adopted Black Labrador/Golden Retriever who flunked out of service dog school and now pays for his lavish ball-chasing lifestyle directing full-length films.  We were really excited to get on his busy schedule for this short clip. 

Bailey, the Service Dog Flunkie

Support this project or my friends from the San Jose Police bike squad will come get you... just kidding :)

story:
About Me.

Hello everyone,

My name is Deighton(Dayton) and I am the creator of "gather. Clothing Company".  I am originally from South Carolina but moved to Wilmington, North Carolina in December of 2012.  Shortly after moving to the area I was drawn to create an image of positivity and community.  I wanted to create an image that when it was seen, would not only comfort but also inspire.  Through a series of events, this image took on the form of what is now "gather.". 

At it's purest form ,"gather.", is a simple message of positivity .  It is about compassionate people coming together and feeling connected to each other and their community.  It is the feeling that makes us all so human, to feel accepted and connected to your surroundings....to your community.  It is what we all do.  It is how we celebrate births, weddings, and life.....we gather.


What the money will be used for.

With this campaign I am raising ten thousand dollars.  Three thousand dollars of the money raised will be used to take "gather. Clothing Company" from what is now a sole-proprietorship, to a Limited Liability Corporation.  This is the recommended legal status for clothing companies at this level because stores can be hesitant to carry a line where legal responsibility is solely on the founder.

That money will also go towards finishing the trademark process of the "gather." logo (lantern and type-face).  This process has already been started but more funds are required to ensure that the lantern designed by "gather. Clothing Company", remains property of "gather. Clothing Company".

Five thousand dollars will go towards fulfilling perks, and creating a base inventory of clothing.  The shirts that will comprise the first collection of "gather. Clothing" will be screen printed locally on American Apparel fabric.  In my quest for the best fitting, highest quality shirt at a reasonable price, American Apparel won hands down.  Until a manufacturer can be obtained to produce shirts that are the quality desired by "gather. Clothing Company", and at a price-point that is reasonable to the consumer, all future shirts will be American Apparel. 

The remaining two thousand dollars will go towards marketing and branding material such as hang tags, stickers, and poly-mailers.  I am very excited to announce the social-media component of "gather."  As previously stated, "gather." is about people feeling connected to their community.  When you buy an article of "gather. clothing", attached to it will be a revolutionary hang tag.  Instead of the typical hang tag that displays basic branding and marketing information on it, "gather." hang tags will actually be square envelopes with high quality "gather." stickers inside.  On the front will be the "gather." logo.  On the back of the envelopes will be a graphic which explains in a fun and engaging process of how taking pictures of where you gather (either by using the sticker, or a picture of you in your gather shirt) and posting them on either the Facebook page or on Instagram/Twitter(@gather_clothing) can automatically enter you into a chance to not only win more "gather. clothing", but also everything from visa gift cards, to the possibility of an Ipad-mini.  There will be challenges issued for the most creative photos submitted, weekly contest, and monthly contest where submissions with the most likes win.


Impact.

When you make a pledge to "gather. Clothing Company", you will not only be supporting community and positivity, but your pledge will also help people globally.  It is my pleasure to announce that 3% of all profits will be donated to the "Liter of Light" project.  "Liter of Light" works in undeveloped countries and installs recycled plastic liter bottles into the roofs of shacks.  These plastic bottles are filled with only water and small amount of bleach.  When the sun hits the top of the bottles, the light is magnified and this creates a natural light bulb for the portion of the bottle that is inside of the shack.  This innovative way of lighting produces the same amount of light that a 55-watt bulb would, except it uses zero electricity.  "gather Clothing Company" is excited to work with "Liter of Light" for many reasons.  First, because the recycling aspect of reusing plastic bottles for an ingenious cause; creating what is essentially a solar powered light bulb with a close to zero carbon footprint.  But also, because of what it symbolizes in regards to the "gather." lantern.  The lantern was chosen as the logo for "gather. Clothing Company" because it represents light illuminating the dark, but also because sometimes we all need a light to gather around.  "Liter of Light" does just that, it illuminates homes using green energy and gives people a light to gather around.  "gather. Clothing Company" feels that it is the social responsibility for all companies to give back in some form.  That is why we are proud to work with "Liter of Light" to help them reach their goal of lighting one million homes by 2015.  Please see the link below for more information on "Liter of Light".

Liter of Lite video

Liter of Light Website

Even if you can not make the $25 pledge for a shirt, there is also the option to make the $10 pledge to receive "gather." stickers.  This is my second crowd funding campaign in regards to "gather.", after having a successful project on another platform.  I look forward to connecting people all across the planet with this message of positivity, but I need your help to make this happen.  I urge you to please back this campaign.  Even if you can not back this campaign financially, back "gather." in other ways like following on Instagram and Twitter(@gather_clothing), and by liking and sharing the facebook page at www.facebook.com/gatherclothingcompany .  Thank you for reading and let's make this happen.

Tell me,......

Where do you gather?

-Deighton

story:
The Circle Towel is the Best Beach Towel.

The Best Beach Towel for Tanning. How often do you reposition your towel to catch the best rays? We love the beach and the sun and after fiddling around with our towels time and time again we decided it was too much!

Our Circle Towels eliminate the need to disrupt your tan schedule while ensuring your neighbor on the sand is comfortable too. Rotating your towel every hour is not only inconvenient for you, but it also makes sand blow all over your neighbors – especially when the wind takes control. Our over-sized beach towels offer the optimal environment for sunbathing. Unlike normal beach towels, our circle towels allow sunbathers to stretch out comfortably and not worry about the hot sand. The circular shape also allows for full rotation without the hassle of shifting your towel.



Quality You Can Count On - Comfort You Deserve.

 

Our towels are perfect for the beach, poolside or by any picnic table.  They are 100% cotton with a luxurious 6' radius. 

The Idea came came to my Business partner Aaron more then a decade ago; I'll let him explain the story:

“I went to the beach wanting to relax but realized that I spent more time moving my towel and shaking off the sand then enjoying the peace and quiet. So I asked myself, why isn't there a circle towel that will put an end to this unnecessary moving and shaking? That’s when the idea came to me! That’s how The CircleTowel.com was born."


The money raised on this Indiegogo campaign will help us with initial inventory and continue marketing of the site and the brand to help beachcombers, pool people and picnickers get more pleasure out of their day.

What We Need & What You Get

  • Ramping up manufacturing to produce a sufficient number of towels for broad distribution coast to coast is costly! We've already placed our first order but to ensure we'll have enough towels for all, we need to have funding in place for order #2.
  • Our Circle Towel is about as "outside the box" you can get so we need a good amount of funds on marketing and raising awareness of why our towels are better and why people will love them.
  • If we fall short of our full funding goal we'll make the best with what we have and produce as many towels as possible around a realistic marketing budget.
  • As a backer of our campaign you get the first crack at our towels with some of the lowest possible prices.


Risks & Challenges

As much as we wanted to produce the towel in the United States the cost was just too high. We found a great company in China that after many months, was finally able to produce The Circle Towel we were looking for. There are always some sort of delay with the final samples or shipping the product from China to the states but we have a great team in place to handle any challenges that may come up.


Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the word and tell all your friends, family and neighbors about our towels.  Use the Indiegogo share tools on this project and keep your Facebook friends and Twitter followers in the know.

story:
Be sure to check the sizing before placing your order! (We will get in touch so you can specify your sizing requirements!)



Sustainability & Design


After developing the product it began to occur to me that it has potential to alleviate one of the largest problems facing humanity at the moment; it helps decrease our non-renewable waste.

We have developed a habit of buying all our produce and things covered in non-reusable wrapping and taking it home in non-reuseable bags. If we shift our habits and use things which are renewable, we can make a difference for the future and cut down our wastage. 

Here's some benefits of the product!


    FAQ's

    When will my ziptwin arrive?

    After production and shipment you can expect your ziptwin by mid-october.

    What do you do with the things you're carrying if you want to wear the ziptwin?

    The ziptwin is ideal for perishable goods and provides an advantage to carry other things. It's not designed to replace backpacks, but can help you carry objects when you don't have a large backpack with you.

    How much can I carry?

    The maximum carrying load suggested is 6kg and 5 liters. 

    What kind of fit is the jacket?

    The fact that it turns into a bag doesn't take anything away from the style or fit of the jacket when you wear it. The ziptwin is a comfortable urban fit. 


    & Finally

    Even if you don't want to contribute I still hope that you have taken something away from my campaign. I've provided some links below on initiatives which I support and believe are great steps for reducing our wastage in the future by alternative and  more sustainable methods. Please share with your friends and family:

    Original Unverpackt; Germany's first supermarket which doesn't provide any packaging on their produce. 

    FSC: "The Forest Stewardship Council mission is to promote environmentally sound, socially beneficial and economically prosperous management of the world's forests. "
    Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

Ebon Supply Company was founded by two grade 11 students from Trail, BC. We are currently an apparel company for the extreme sports industry. However we want to expand into hard goods so that we can have an impact on the performance of athletes in the industry. We feel that goggles are a great place to start, but since we're limited with funds, we couldn't get very good ones. And that just won't do. We want to become a leading brand in the extreme sports industry, and high quality products are the only way to get there. We are very serious for our age, and recently won the Junior Dragons Den business competition in our home town. This has made product expansion a reality for our company, but we're still a little short on funds if we want high quality goggles for this ski / snowboard season, and still fund our other projects related to the company.

What We Need & Why

If reached, the $700 goal amount allows us to get our first order of high quality polarized goggles. The anti-fog, anti-scratch, and anti-glare of these goggles will certainly be an asset for consumers. When its competition time, sun glare can make or break your run. Vision is everything, and why compromise it when you don't have to? We hope to provide a product that is the solution to this problem. Which will grow our brand reputability, and give athletes a product that allows them to perform their best,  in a cool sleek design that compares or outclasses other products on the market.

The Impact

Your contributions will allow our company to expand at a quicker rate. We're very small and just started off, but we really think Ebon Supply Co. could go somewhere. As students, we would like to see this be what we do for the rest of our lives. The expansion could propel our brand to the track of success. Your contribution could literally turn our dreams into reality, and build a fantastic company dedicated to supporting athletes and providing quality products.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Unable to contribute?

    We totally get that. If you still want to help out, spread the word about us! As a small company, our biggest hurdle is simply exposure. We need people to know who we are, share on facebook, twitter, instagram, or just tell your friends. Anything you could do to help get our name out there, would be a huge help to our company!

    Our website is: www.ebonsupply.co

story:
REPUBLIC is a comfortable, smart, and fashionable apparel line capturing true Colorado culture and lifestyle.  While the Colorado flag is prominent in apparel design and in many instances the sole design element, REPUBLIC focuses on capturing the essence of Colorado culture through an open sourced network of design thinkers from around the State.  Our focus is primarily directed toward cultural relevance outside of the predictable while maintaining both a high level of comfort and style, thereby achieving a modern look that can confidently be worn in any environment.  

REPUBLIC is about You!  It's about the people who love the State and its relaxed outdoor lifestyle.  Whether you are a guest, admirer of the outdoor lifestyle from afar, or a proud native who wouldn't think about living anywhere else, we speak your language.  Regardless of our reasoning, we are brought together by our affinity for Colorado.  Additionally, REPUBLIC provides greater awareness for our State, endorsing the Colorado lifestyle on a global scale.  REPUBLIC is both a fashion and unification statement, promoting a metro-resort feel for everyday application.          

What defines Colorado culture for you?  We would like to know!  Please purchase one of our available t-shirts in support of our concept through Indiegogo.  Additionally, share your definition or design expressing what Colorado culture means to you on our Facebook page for a chance to win a REPUBLIC t-shirt line with your definition or design, signed by you! 

Join the revolution. Wear REPUBLIC.  Express your affinity for Colorado, but with style! Choose one these stylish shirts below and wear it with pride!

The Deal

With well over 70 REPUBLIC hat, t-shirt, and sweatshirt designs circulating the retail marketplace, we now require phase II funding to help with brand awareness.   

The phase II capital approach is simple--buy one, two, three or more limited edition REPUBLIC shirt(s) for $25 each and help us get closer to our financial goal !  Buy one for yourself and another for a neighbor, friend, trash man, firefighter, or even your mom!

The Impact

All funds received are much appreciated and will be put to good use.  We hope, at the very least, to fund our exposure at upcoming industry trade shows throughout the State.  All funds received during this campaign will be applied responsibly to the expansion of our efforts.

The Result

This fundraising campaign serves to establish REPUBLIC as a lifestyle image for Colorado.  Reaching our fundraising goal supplies necessary capital to gain needed exposure on both a retail and wholesale level.  REPUBLIC serves not only as a collective approach to expressing Colorado lifestyle, it serves to create awareness for our State from a multidimensional perspective.  Those dawning REPUBLIC apparel serve as ambassadors for our State, establishing a people's mark for Colorado lifestyle.
