It is in our heart to promote fun yet responsible dog caring and improving the lives of our beloved pups the way they bring joy to us.





Lucky Tag started with a group of pet lovers from both technical and creative background hoping to create something that is beneficial to their pups. With wearables being the talk of the market and our expertise in beacon technology, it hit us, “why not do what we do best and create an useful wearable for our pups?”
After months of testing and refining the concept, we narrowed it down to 3 major features: Dog’s Health Tracker, Find My Dog and Social Interaction Between Dog Owners.
Yet, the best part is: 
This idea just got patented and we are now brining it to everyone with an affordable and competitive price so that we can all have peace of mind when it comes to our fluffy friend.
That’s why we designed Lucky Tag.





Design
Lucky Tag consists of a core unit and a strap. It is super adorable and comes in 8 fun colors. 


Not only is it cute and eye-catching but also very light and sturdy with a rugged, waterproof casing.
As amazing as it sounds, there also lies the most important question of all- Is it safe?
To address that issue, we adopted the FDA-certified non-allergic, soft silicone. It is completely safe, non toxic and can be easily and securely attached to any collar to avoid being bitten off or broken by pups themselves. 
Oh and, YES, Lucky Tag does come in small sizes for smaller dogs as well.



Technology
Because we care about our pups as much as we care about ourselves, we have decided to use the best sensor chips we could find, along with temperature sensor and G sensor to automatically collect and record the data detected onto our Mobile Beacons. 

On top of that, we also managed to provide wide RF search range without consuming much power.  Unlike those GPS-centric devices which consumes lots of power, we designed Lucky Tag in a way that you don't need to change it for at least another 4 to 6 months and we use the most common CR2032 battery which does not require weekly charging. In English, it saves lots of power and that's the beauty of applying beacon technology!  
Lucky Tag is iOS and Android-compatible and devices must be using Apple iOS 7 or 8 or Android 4.3 or higher with Bluetooth 4.0. 


We have ample experience in GPS and RF technology, not to mention the fact that the Airyzone Mobile Beacon we designed has temperature sensing capability as well as low power-consumption. 
For the past year, our Mobile Beacon has been successfully applied to various industries, such as semi-conductor manufacturing, transportation technology and smart shopping.
Learning from the experiences, we decided to further utilize it and embed it onto our most exciting product ever- Lucky Tag.
As of now, we have already completed the followings:

Dec 31, 2014 Lucky Tag Prototype
Jan 31, 2015 filing or FCC, CE
Mar 31, 2015 Lucky Tag Hub  Prototype 
Apr 30, 2015 App Design Complete
May 15, 2015 Mass Production
Jun 30, 2015 Ready for Shipping

And to move forward, we need your support!
Please do pledge and help spread the words, we will really appreciate it!





Risks & Challenges
  The biggest challenges we are facing would be the limitation of beacon technology which the "Find My Dog" feature of Lucky Tag is based on. It relies on the collaborative support and power of a mass community. Meaning, if there are more people using it within a certain range, the higher the density, the better the feature works. However, if there are only a couple of users, then the feature will not be able to fully function. And, that is exactly why we need your support to help us build and grow the community. Please back us and be part of the revolution.FAQ 

 How is Lucky Tag different from all the other pet wearables out there? 
Lucky Tag is the very first dog wearable that combines three functions into one device, satisfying the needs of pet healthcare, LBS social among near by dog owners, and searching for missing dogs. Most of the products in the market features only one function let alone two.
Yes, there are many KEY-Finder type of products in the market, including the Tile and TrackR, but these are all based on Bluetooth FindMe profile. On the technical side, Lucky Tag is based on a new kind of technology called Airyzone Mobile Beacon, which is very similar to Apple's iBeacon, but with much lower power-consumption. This difference in technology results in the high efficiency in finding lost dogs.
Last updated:  



 How does the "Find My Dog" feature works exactly? 
We use beacon technology to locate missing dogs. For example, if one lost dog with Lucky-Tag is walking around on the street, then other Lucky-Tag App users within 40 to 100 meters can help the dog owner locate his/her whereabout quickly. On the other hand, for all the other KEY-Finder products out there,  their App can only find items within 30 meters at most.
Last updated:  



 In terms of locating missing dogs, how is the Beacon Technology approach different from the GPS approach? 
Regarding the cost and accessibility, yes, there are a few products in the marketplace that combine both GPS and motion sensor for pet healthcare and pet searching, however, the problem is that they are either too expensive, power-consuming or in need of a monthly GSM SIM card subscription fee. Most importantly, those products can only operation without recharging for up to three or five days. In comparison of those devices, Lucky Tag uses a CR2032 battery which does not require weekly charging and the battery life can last up to 6 month till the next replacement.

story:
Who We Are And What We Do!

Drevo Optics was born out of a desire for a father and son to come together on a joint venture. With over 40 years of specialty wood experience, we know wood.  We know which is the strongest, the most flexible and which species can knock you out with stunning colors and grain textures. We saw a need in the wood sunglasses market for true craftsmen, and that is where Drevo comes in.

We are so excited to be launching this venture and joining the community of skilled craftsmen and women creating exceptional wares for all to enjoy. Come back often as we hope to be growing quickly and releasing new styles and frames.

We are launching our campaign with flexible funding to help us get all the help we can for our mill. Don't worry though, whatever you order, you will get by January. 

 


How Our Wooden Sunglasses Are Made

The process in actually pretty complicated, but we will break it down into the basics: 1. Blocks of rosewood are milled out of our own designs on our CNC machine. Once the process of milling is done the real work begins. 2. We hand sand down all of the fames and temples so to get out all of the small imperfections. 3. We then apply a sealer and a finish. 4. The glasses are then taken to a separate room to dry and be fully assembled with lenses and spring-loaded hinges. 


Our Current Models

As of right now we are only offering a limited production of the above model: The Frame is milled from Rosewood with Polycarbonate Bronze Mirrored Lenses made by Carl Ziess. As these become more popular we will start offering the bottom frames in limited production as well. 

Drevo Classic

Fits Medium-Large Faces

Frame Width (5.575”/141.5mm)

The A-Frames L

Fits Medium-Large Faces

Frame Width (5.50”/140mm)

The A-Frames S

Fits Small- Medium Faces

Frame Width (5.38”/136.5mm)


What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to reach $17,000. As of right now we mill every pair of glasses out of a retro-fitted 1985 CNC machine. We are looking to upgrade to a little more current model that will allow us to make more sunglasses for you guys. 
We are so grateful for your donations that we have set up a line of perks so you can get something in return for your generosity. We will have perks from a personal thank you letter from the company, to redeemable coupons, sunglasses, and sweatshirts. 


The Impact

We have been building this company for the last three years and it is now a reality for us. All of the design work and prototyping has finally paid off and we are ready to go. The only problem is we need more machines! And machines are expensive. This money could help us out more than even we realize. 


Risks & Challenges

Luckily for people contributing there is not a whole lot of risk. Our company is up and running and we are milling out our wooden sunglasses. We just want the ability to grow and to be able to produce more sunglasses.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that everybody can't contribute, but if you could share our page or mention our company to a buddy, that would help us out so much! We thank you for the time you spent with us!

story:
The Inspiration

Something Old is Something New is a wedding line of 9 wedding gowns and 5 bridesmaid dress. They will all be made using recycled and vintage materials, and they will have an alluring charm that can only be found when you bring so many unique components together into a beautiful work of art. 

I have been making wedding bouquets and accessories for awhile now, and I love making beautiful things that make people smile. I believe it is time to expand my wedding line a further by creating the clothing to match the bouquets and accessories I already create. You can check out my style, sales, and my feedback on my etsy shop. 

I am focusing on the wedding section of my shop because I love the fantasy concept and idea, but I make a ton of other items including jewelry, costumes, wigs, funny greeting cards, and home decor items. For this reason I am offering an option ith my perks to choose items from my shops or receive custom made grab bags of goodies tailered to your personality.

What I Need

I am completely enamored with the idea of making wedding gowns and bridesmaid dresses out of recycled and vintage fabrics and slips. I have several slips and sketches ready to roll, and my sewing machine is all greased up, but I don't have a mannequin or dress form to be able to make these dresses really come to life. The best price on a dress form that I can find is $114, so I figure with tax and shipping I need about $150.

I absolutely love the idea of adding fabric flowers and recycled bits of chiffon and lace to make rustic and romantic dresses that create a fairytale feeling. I already have a whole bunch of vintage slips I will use for the base of these dresses, and  I figure for 9 gowns and 5 bridesmaid dresses I will need about $300 in fabric, clothing, thread, and vintage jewelry.  After the fees from kickstarter and amazon I figure $450 should be enough to get this project off the ground. 

What You Get

I love perks and I would be open to any custom requests or ideas. So feel free to comment and I will respond ASAP. 

My first perk, for $5, is a shout out on my all my social networking accounts.

For $10 you get a handwritten thank you note and a small toy or trinket I have found in my salvaging.

For $25 you receive the previous reward as well as a $25 igft certificate to my etsy shop or I can make you a custom grab bag filled with handmade items and salvaged items you will love.

For $50 you get the thank card, small trinket, grab bag or git certificate, and you get to choose the name of one of the dresses I will debut in this clothing line. I love this idea because it means your name will live on with the production of these dresses for years to come, and I will make sure to link to you in the listing as well as any other place the dress is displayed.

For $100 you will receive a a yummy and inspirational treat. You will receive the card, the trinket, the gift certificate or grab bag, you will get to name a dress, and I will send you a 6 homemade cupcakes in your flavor choice and an inspirational word art painting.

For $250 you will receive all of the above PLUS a custom made dress. It will be made o your specific measurements, colors, style, and desire. I will work with you one-on-one during the entire process. 

The Impact

This project will have a positive impact on the environment because it will cause less waste and more beauty. It is my intention to provide the sponsors with a feeling of joy and delight as I catalog my journey through this process. This will allow me to make beautiful items that make other people very happy. The recycled materials will allow me to sell the wedding gowns for less than most wedding gowns which will allow brides-to-be feel like princesses on their big day without going broke. 

 

What I Will Do With the Funds

I have so many ideas that I actually dream about it, and I have already recruited a bunch of my girlfriends to help me with a photo shoot when the Something Old is Something New line of clothing is complete. It is going to be a really beautiful photo shoot since I already have a bunch of bouquets and accessories that will perfectly match the  dresses. 

 If I do not reach my goal, I will still purchase the dressform and as much materials as I can, and I will make the fasion line slmaller as appropriate to the funding. I can start shipping rewards and release photos of the finished fashion line in the end of May. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Remember if you can't contribute you can still help me out a ton by sharing this with friends, commenting with positive encouragement or your own inspiration and ideas, and spreading positive energy everyday. Even if that its only a small smile at a random stranger.

Thank You

Thank to everyone reading this for giving me the time to share my inspiration and joy with you! If you can't conribute, I completey understand; please share this campaign with your freinds and family!

story:
Hello. I'm Jillian Mirenzi, a young recent college graduate with a passion for sewing. Since my mother taught me to sew at age 12, I have honed my craft and admired vintage clothes and costumes. I have been sewing them for myself ever since. So why not bring the same garments to other women as well? I am looking to start up an Etsy.com store to sell vintage-inspired pieces for the modern woman.

Proposed Designs for First Line
 
Modernized 1920s dresses inspired by recent film and television. See even more inspiration at http://pinterest.com/pastispresent/past-is-present-designs-inspiration-board/.


$1,000 is the target goal to act as a start-up. Your contribution will aide in getting the necessities for any good seamstress company, both small (drafting tools, thread, trims, and other notions) and large (a serger machine, fabric, and large rolls of paper for pattern making). Pretty essential stuff. The funding will also help pay Etsy listing fees and charges. Any extra money raised will also go into buying these items but in better quality/larger quantity.

If you decide to contribute, you will receive much gratitude in the form of thank yous, credits, discounts, and even a garment made specifically for you.


Examples Recent Works

I have been sewing for over half of my life now, and there are no words to express how passionate I am about it. Instead, to show the world what I love, I want to give a little piece of that to other people through the form of a hand-made, well-crafted garment. Sometimes it is the dress that makes a woman feel wonderful and confident, and what better way is there to extend my joy to her than to make that very dress for her.

To help reach my target goal it is imperative for as many people as possible to hear about the project. So, even if you can't contribute, please share this on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, or just plain e-mail.

Whatever you're able to offer is greatly appreciated! No amount of help is too small.

story:
Where We've Been & Where We Want To Go

Hi, my name is Larry Peck and I am the president and founder of Demanding Products, Inc. in the Atlanta, GA area.  In 2005 I launched www.YourNameUniversity.com, a unique web site that allows you to personalize apparel products with a university name of your own.  Since then, we have added several new design categories and now offer more than 90 products.  But the current image creation process is 100% manual and we are limited in the number of designs and color schemes we can offer.

In 2008, I came up with the idea to offer the same "Your Name" concept but with a much larger variety of designs.  No longer limited to just "University" or "Property Of" designs, we can allow our customers to personalize many different styles of designs based on a variety of businesses.  

YourNameGear.com will allow us to offer all of our customers:

1.  Better quality designs.

2.  More apparel product and color choices.

3.  New designs containing white ink.

4.  100% automation of design image creation.

5.  More choices of embroidered products (hats, fleece, scarves, etc.)

Our Cool New Printing Technology

YourNameGear.com will use state-of-the-art Kornit Digital Inkjet Garment Printers for all printed designs.  These amazing high-quality/high-volume printers will allow us to meet flexible demand schedules and keep our production costs down and pass the savings along to our customers.

To see a video on how this amazing technology works, click on the printer image below.

Look at the picture below to see how much better Digital Inkjet Printing holds up over time against typical silk-screen printing.

We only offer the highest quality apparel for our customers and are constantly looking for new gear to add to our product line-up.

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise a minimum of $70,000 in funding to make YourNameGear.com happen.  The proceeds from this funding will enable us to completely upgrade our apparel design and printing functionality and improve our order fulfillment processes.  It will also allow us to implement a few new product ideas that we can't talk about publicly yet, but they are very cool and no one is doing it yet.

As our way of saying thank you for your contribution to the YourNameGear.com campaign, we are offering 8 unique perks for you to choose from.

 

 

YOUTH/ADULT T-SHIRT

Our high-quality youth/adult t-shirts are available in various colors and sizes.  They feature: 

  • 6.1-ounce, 100% cotton (preshrunk)
  • Seamless double-needle collar
  • Double-needle sleeves and hem
  • Taped neck and shoulders

 

 

 

YOUTH/ADULT LONG SLEEVE T-SHIRT

Our high-quality youth/adult long sleeve t-shirts are available in various colors and sizes.  They feature: 

  • Heavyweight 6.1-ounce, 100% cotton
  • Coverseamed neck
  • Shoulder-to-shoulder taping
  • Rib knit cuffs
  • Double-needle hem

 

 

YOUTH/ADULT CREWNECK SWEATSHIRT

Our high-quality youth/adult crewneck sweatshirts are available in various colors and sizes.  They feature: 

  • 9-ounce, 50/50 cotton/poly fleece
  • Coverseamed crewneck, arm seams and waistband
  • Spandex in collar, cuffs and waistband
  • Set-in sleeves

 

 

YOUTH/ADULT HOODED SWEATSHIRT

Our high-quality youth/adult hooded sweatshirts are available in various colors and sizes.  They feature: 

  • 9-ounce, 50/50 cotton/poly fleece
  • Two-ply hood
  • Dyed-to-match drawcord
  • Set-in sleeves
  • Front pouch pocket

 

 

 

 

 

You will be able to choose from ALL of the designs we have available at YourNameGear.com launch to print on YOUR perk.

In addition, we will be offering a variety of special promotional discounts for campaign contributors for the first year after YourNameGear.com has launched.

We Want To Hear Your Design Ideas!

The number of designs we can create for YourNameGear.com are unlimited and we want to hear what you want to see on YourNameGear.com!   If you have an idea for a design you want us to offer, please leave it in the comments section and we will review it as soon as possible. 

The Impact Your Contribution Will Make

YourNameGear.com has been a dream of mine since 2008.  And while YourNameUniversity.com has been moderately successful, the financial crisis of 2007 set back our plans to develop the YourNameGear.com project.

The availability of sites like IndieGOGO.com and this crowdfunding campaign can make this dream come true in the next few months with your generous help.

How We Will Use The Funds

The web site design; back office processes; and image rendering processes have been completely spec'd out and reviewed.   As you can see by the image above we have plenty of designs in the works with more to come!

The proceeds from this campaign will be used to build out YourNameGear.com and all of the back office software and processes.  In addition, our award-winning creative director, Frank Loconsole, will work his magic on all of our designs before launch. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the money at this time to contribute to our YourNameGear.com campaign, we completely understand.  Times are tough for many people in our country.  

But we hope you will take a second to share our campaign on facebook, twitter, and via email.

Site Launch

We expect the site to launch at the beginning of May 2013.  After the site launches, each contributor will receive an email containing detailed instructions how to redeem their perk.

Shipping Charges

When you redeem your perk after YourNameGear.com launches, you will be charged shipping/handling based on the weight of your perk and the distance it is being shipped.  All perks will be shipped via USPS Priority Mail.

We only offer the highest quality apparel for our customers and are constantly looking for new gear to add to our product line-up.

What We Need & What You Get


We need to raise a minimum of $70,000 in funding to make YourNameGear.com happen.  The proceeds from this funding will enable us to completely upgrade our apparel design and printing functionality and improve our order fulfillment processes.  It will also allow us to implement a few new product ideas that we can't talk about publicly yet, but they are very cool and no one is doing it yet.
As our way of saying thank you for your contribution to the YourNameGear.com campaign, we are offering 8 unique perks for you to choose from.
 

 
YOUTH/ADULT T-SHIRT
Our high-quality youth/adult t-shirts are available in various colors and sizes.  They feature: 

6.1-ounce, 100% cotton (preshrunk)
Seamless double-needle collar
Double-needle sleeves and hem
Taped neck and shoulders

 
 
 

YOUTH/ADULT LONG SLEEVE T-SHIRT
Our high-quality youth/adult long sleeve t-shirts are available in various colors and sizes.  They feature: 

Heavyweight 6.1-ounce, 100% cotton
Coverseamed neck
Shoulder-to-shoulder taping
Rib knit cuffs
Double-needle hem

 

 
YOUTH/ADULT CREWNECK SWEATSHIRT
Our high-quality youth/adult crewneck sweatshirts are available in various colors and sizes.  They feature: 

9-ounce, 50/50 cotton/poly fleece
Coverseamed crewneck, arm seams and waistband
Spandex in collar, cuffs and waistband
Set-in sleeves

 
 

YOUTH/ADULT HOODED SWEATSHIRT
Our high-quality youth/adult hooded sweatshirts are available in various colors and sizes.  They feature: 

9-ounce, 50/50 cotton/poly fleece
Two-ply hood
Dyed-to-match drawcord
Set-in sleeves
Front pouch pocket

 
 
 
 
 
You will be able to choose from ALL of the designs we have available at YourNameGear.com launch to print on YOUR perk.
In addition, we will be offering a variety of special promotional discounts for campaign contributors for the first year after YourNameGear.com has launched.
We Want To Hear Your Design Ideas!
The number of designs we can create for YourNameGear.com are unlimited and we want to hear what you want to see on YourNameGear.com!   If you have an idea for a design you want us to offer, please leave it in the comments section and we will review it as soon as possible. 
The Impact Your Contribution Will Make


YourNameGear.com has been a dream of mine since 2008.  And while YourNameUniversity.com has been moderately successful, the financial crisis of 2007 set back our plans to develop the YourNameGear.com project.
The availability of sites like IndieGOGO.com and this crowdfunding campaign can make this dream come true in the next few months with your generous help.
How We Will Use The Funds
The web site design; back office processes; and image rendering processes have been completely spec'd out and reviewed.   As you can see by the image above we have plenty of designs in the works with more to come!
The proceeds from this campaign will be used to build out YourNameGear.com and all of the back office software and processes.  In addition, our award-winning creative director, Frank Loconsole, will work his magic on all of our designs before launch. 


Other Ways You Can Help
If you don't have the money at this time to contribute to our YourNameGear.com campaign, we completely understand.  Times are tough for many people in our country.  
But we hope you will take a second to share our campaign on facebook, twitter, and via email.
Site Launch
We expect the site to launch at the beginning of May 2013.  After the site launches, each contributor will receive an email containing detailed instructions how to redeem their perk.
Shipping Charges
When you redeem your perk after YourNameGear.com launches, you will be charged shipping/handling based on the weight of your perk and the distance it is being shipped.  All perks will be shipped via USPS Priority Mail.

story:
Hi my name is Claire Robinson. I am currently completing a Bachelors Degree at Emily Carr University of Art and Design in Film Video and Integrated Media. I am also an inventor of a patented lid design titled “Liquid Container Cap With Integral Steeper”. I am producing a documentary, which will illuminate the process of rendering a unique idea into a multifaceted product. My journey as an inventor and entrepreneur will be the focus of this documentary. Although I have some existing funds for producing this documentary film I am pursuing further funds by offering the opportunity to be named in the credits of this film (among other perks). As an Indigenous inventor and entrepreneur I am committed to producing a film that will inspire other inventors. Please join me in this journey by supporting the production of this film with your monetary contribution. Contributions will be compensated proportionate to the “perk level” indicated in the column to the right of this caption.

Check out my blog: http://claire2bee.wordpress.com/2012/05/18/mypatent/ ‎

story:
Quality Eyewear For Your Demanding Lifestyle

3 Prototypes Ready to go... 

Funding will be used for design and fabrication for these 3 Prototypes which will be part of our future collection. Thank you, you will be quickly rewarded(5-6 days) with Quality Eyewear from our current collection PLUS introductory rates on our upcoming collection.

Prototypes will come in an Assortment of Frame and Lens Colors and we are utilizing the same PRECISION LS(R) Lenses that we use in our current collection, so you will have the best vision and protection under the sun.  Prototypes will come in a medium/large/Xlarge and ASIAN FIT frame option so there will be a style and a fit for everyone.

Questions ?  Comments ?  A favorite frame color ? Have some cool names for our Prototypes ?  Please let us know what you think !

Learn more about our quality eyewear at www.hawaiianoptics.com

Mahalo for your support.   E Komo Mai !  Welcome to Hawaiian Optics.

HOW IT WORKS:

  • Choose a Perk
  • You Receive Quality Eyewear at a Great Rate within 5-6 days
  • You Receive a Discount Code on our Future Collection

 

PROTOTYPE A:  Injection High Fashion Wrap

Injection high fashion wrap features deco metal inlay trim and corresponding cloisonné logo detail. Inset custom nose pads allow for Asian fit with optimal fit and comfort. 

 

PROTOTYPE B: Oversized Bold Rectangle Injection Wrap

Oversized bold rectangle injection wrap frame balances a powerful silhouette with clean straight forward lines. A chrome signature stamped bar logo aesthetically bonds front to temple. Inset silicon nose pads allow custom Asian fit option, internal spring hinges, silicon temple tip.

 

PROTOTYPE C: Modified Classic Oversized Aviator

 

Modified classic oversized aviator featuring a contemporary paddle temple design.  Chrome polished or matte nickel low profile frame front holds an 8 base lens for full wrap fit, spring hinges, goose-neck Asian fit silicon nose pads.  Precision stamped logo, and hand finished zyl temples complete a customized look for a traditional style.

 

Perks  

  • $3 - Sticker 6-Pack + 10% Discount Code

  • $15 - Hard Case and Cleaning cloth + 10% Discount Code

  • $50 - (1) Pair from current collection + 10% Discount Code 

  • $60 - (1) Pair from current collection + 10% Discount Code

  • $75 - (1) Pair from current collection + 20% Discount Code

  • $130 - (2) Pairs from current collection + 20% Discount Code

  • $180 - (3) Pairs from current collection + 20% Discount Code

  • $330 - (6) Pairs from current collection + 25% Discount Code

  • $500 - (10) Pairs from current collection + 25% Discount Code

 

How to Redeem Perks

This Special Offer is for a limited time and is only valid through the Indiegogo web site.

You will receive an email from our company confirming your order requesting the following information.  Please reply via email. 

  • Choose Eyewear from www.hawaiianoptics.com
  • Provide Model Number, Model Name and Model Frame Color
  • Confirm shipping address
  • Payment is through PayPal.  You can also use Any Credit Card through the PayPal platform.
  • You will receive eyewear in 5-6 days.  International 8-12 days.
  • 100% Exchange Policy Guarantee

 

*International Shipping is via USPS and can take between 8-12 days from Hawaii.

*Hard Case not included with eyewear when purchased through this website.

**Product Reference Note.  While supplies last, meaning - if for some reason everybody chooses the same pair and color we might run out of that selection so you will have to choose another color or style.  If all your selections are sold out, you can substitute it with a pair from our new line.

 

Sticker 6-Pack(3 of each):  2"W x 6"L

Hard Case and Cleaning Cloth

 

Our Current Eyewear Collection

See Full Collection at www.hawaiianoptics.com 

 

Queens

Warrior

Primo

Akamai

Archipelago

Ko'olau

 

Lens Technology

PRECISION LS(R)  Our lenses are made for us by Essilor, the largest and most trusted lens company in the world.  Our lenses  block 100% of UVA, UVB, UVC and harmful blue light up to 400 nanometers.  Our lenses are extremely impact resistant.  2 Year Warranty

AR3(R)  Anti-reflective coating applied to back side of lenses to absorb glare and reduce eye strain.

TRITON  Hydrophobic/Oleophobic coating applied to both sides of the lenses to repel water, sweat, oils, dirt and debris.   Easy Clean Technology.

PRO TECH(R)  Industrial strength anti-scratch coating applied to both sides of the lenses.

 

Company  Information

Hawaiian Optics is a family owned business from the island of Kauai. We have been designing quality and technically advanced eyewear since 2006. Why... because when you live in Hawaii you learn a lot about the sun ! Also, we have almost 7 million tourists a year coming to Hawaii that need protection for their eyes. It's a full time job !

Recently, Patrick Hussey, former designer and co-founder of Spy Optics, joined our team. He is very passionate about our product. He is pumping out some awesome prototype designs for our upcoming collection and he is using a very interesting hybrid combination of polymers and alloys. He is also designing an "Asian Fit" in all our new styles.

Competition: Our competition is Maui Jim. They are global, they are pretty much everywhere. Great sunglasses and the company does extremely well, basically in the hundreds of millions. With their styles and price points you mostly see the older generation wear them, which is good for us because we are picking up the younger minded market share. In fact, some people refer to us as the Oakley version of Maui Jim.

Our Logo: In Hawaii, the triangle represents strength, protection and balance in one's life. The triangle in our eyewear logo represents our "Eye Armor" but is also a perfect logo for an apparel and accessory line in the future.

Thank you for your support. Aloha !

 

Logo Hat and Visor

*Out of Stock.  Product will be availabe in 30 days, we will add Perk at that time.

story:
The biggest problems with most desktop 3D printers are that after a couple of months, signs of wear and tear start to show. When this happens and the carrier rails and belts start losing tension, you have to manually adjust them in regular basis; or replace large parts of your printer.

LOCOOP Y is the first 3D printer without carrier rails, which makes it extremely durable and reliable. It also means that you don't have to waste time maintaining the printer’s condition. This saves you on filament, spare parts and most importantly, time.






More Time for Making. Less Time Calibrating.

When we started making LOCOOP Y our benchmark was the ink jet printer. Essentially a machine that anyone with some basic computer knowledge could set up and consistently get the results they expect. 

  • Auto Calibration
  • Auto Leveling



Beautifully Designed. Easy to Use.

3D printing with LOCOOP Y is easy and intuitive. Also, we've made sure that there's no filament hanging off the side. LOCOOP makes it easy to check the progress of your print with the door closed, and you can easily remove the print bed as necessary.

  • Embedded filament holder (rotating base)
  • Detachable print bed
  • Large, transparent door
  • Touch screen LCD panel & SD card slot

Assembles in a Snap.

Putting LOCOOP Y together couldn’t be easier. The top assembly comes as a single piece, so there are no small parts to fiddle with. The print head snaps into place in seconds thanks to magnetic joints.

  • Fully assembled top assembly
  • Case, door, bottom plate and the legs need assembly



Print Big. Hassle-free.

Size matters when it comes to prototyping and making cool things. LOCOOP Y can print up to 180mm x 200mm with precision, reliability, and no layer shift. Hit print when you leave the office, and it will be done by the morning. It also runs on half the energy consumption of a conventional 3D printer.

With every printer we will include a 1 kg spool of filament and a 4GB SD card. 



Help us deliver LOCOOP Y to you!

We've got two working prototypes printing and testing non-stop right now, but we need your help to ramp up production and deliver LOCOOP Y to you. Your support in our Indiegogo campaign will help us commercialize the world's first 'original delta' 3D printer.


We were inspired by the Delta Robot, invented in the 1980s by Swiss Professor Reymond Clavel. Three individually operated arms move with incredible precision controlling the robot's head.

LOCOOP Y is the first 3D printer to bring this technology to mass market.

Cartesian and linear delta 3D printers need to keep constant tension on carrier rails. This causes friction that leads to faster wear and tear on vital components. LOCOOP Y doesn't have carrier rails. Instead, its arms move in precise circular patterns, increasing reliability over the long-term.

 



The most common error that plagues 3D printers is layer shift. It happens as Cartesian and linear delta printers gradually lose tension on their carrier rails.

Based on our experience, layer shift is most likely to occur three-quarters of the way through a big print, when you're on a tight deadline.

By eliminating carrier rails on the LOCOOP Y, we've also eliminated layer shift.



Industrial machines are used thousands if not millions of times a day and stay reliable. We asked ourselves, "Why can't 3D printers be the same?"

The three-armed Delta Robot that inspired our Original Delta technology is used in industries where precision is mission critical, including packaging, high precision assembly, pharmaceuticals, and even in surgeries.

LOCOOP Y has a 50 micron printing resolution, but more importantly, it maintains that level of precision over time. We've run prints up to 48 hours with no print errors.



  • Large Door: LOCOOP Y’s huge front facing door makes it easy to remove even the largest of prints.
  • Extra-Large Removable Bed: The polycarbonate surface is specially textured to make sure prints adhere well, stay flat, and don't curl up at the edges. The bed also comes out easily so that you can remove objects without damaging them. 
  • Memory Card Slot: Transfer your designs easily to LOCOOP Y by using a memory card up to 4GB. That's four times the memory supported by most 3D printers.
  • Less Energy Consumption: At just 60 Watts, LOCOOP Y uses half the energy of a conventional 3D Printer, making it super efficient and environment friendly. Think of what this would mean for a lab or school running multiple printers at the same time.
  • Open Source "CURA" Compatibility: LOCOOP Y is compatible with the CURA interface that you already know and love. (It's the most popular open-source slicer available!) Nothing new to learn. Start exporting G-code immediately.




Need extra filament? You can add extra rolls of the filament we use every day for our prints at LOCOOP. We've secured a very special price of just $25. (Only valid as an add-on when you order LOCOOP Y.)

  • Red Filament
  • Blue Filament
  • Black Filament
  • White Filament
  • Yellow Filament
  • Green Filament
  • Orange Filament
  • Natural Filament
  • Gold Filament
  • Gray Filament



Comprised of a Ph.D of Science in Astronomy from Seoul National University, and a Ph.D of Science in Physics from KAIST, the founding team is passionate about using technology to realize creative ideas. 

We want to make 3D printing easy, to make it available for everyone as a tool to materialize their creations; and ultimately to 3D print homes on Mars.


We have teamed up with one of Asia’s most experienced, precision manufacturing companies, Intops. They help us with the design, development, and the manufacturing process of LOCOOP Y. Their Paper Program, which they fund along with the Industrial Bank of Korea (IBK), supports technology-competitive hardware startups in bringing their products to the market. Some projects brought to life by the Paper Program on Indiegogo include; MicroBot Push and Embrace. This early recognition of our work by industry experts makes us confident that we can deliver LOCOOP Y to you by the end of 2016.


The Iron Throne

Storm Trooper

Ambiguous Cylinder Illusion

Interlocking Gears

Marvin Benchmark Print


Folding Box

Indiegogo!

Venus Box

Gyrosphere


On the print bed


What are the shipping costs?

Shipping rates range from $10 to $250. Please check the specific rate and tariffs for your country.

• South Korea: $10
• East Asia, South East Asia: $80
• North America, Oceania, India: $90
• Europe: $130
• Rest of the world: $250

What is your refund policy?

We’re keeping things in accordance with Indiegogo Standards and unfortunately cannot offer refunds. BUT! if there are perk changes or if there’s some mixing and matching you’d like to do, please contact us at preorder@locoop.net. 

How far along are you in design and production? Where will LOCOOP Y be assembled?

We’re primed and ready for launch! Right now we’re working with our manufacturing partner, Intops, to finalize production. We’re putting LOCOOP Y together in the same high tech, precision factories that Intops uses to produce smartphones and accessories in Korea. Their Paper Program for hardware startups have a proven track record and we’re excited to see the original LOCOOP Y’s brothers and sisters all over the world.

How can you make these printers so affordable?

Thanks for the compliment! The printer uses fewer components than others because it uses industry-inspired Original Delta Technology. This makes it more affordable and more reliable. Our relationship with our manufacturing partner, Intops, means that we can source and assemble the best components at a competitive cost.

When will my printer arrive? 

As soon as possible! We’re targeting a December 2016 ship date. The exact arrival date will depend on country, customs, or delivery status.

What comes with the printer? 

Every printer comes with a 1 kg spool of filament, a 4GB SD card and a 100-240V 60W power adapter.

What slicers are compatible with LOCOOP Y?

LOCOOP Y is compatible with CURA, an open source slicer that has become incredibly popular because it is so easy and intuitive to use. 

How much set up does LOCOOP Y need before I make my first print?

Setup couldn’t be easier with LOCOOP Y. Use the touchscreen on LOCOOP Y and it will auto level the bed, warm up your filament and initiate printing! It’s that easy!

How big is LOCOOP Y?

LOCOOP Y is 50cm wide x 47cm deep and 60cm high. We prefer the phrase ‘big and beautiful’

 What filament diameter can LOCOOP Y use?

LOCOOP Y uses the standard 1.75mm PLA filament. It will extrude any PLA filament of this diameter.

 What types of filaments can I use?

We have tested LOCOOP Y to run with 1.75mm PLA for the best results. LOCOOP Y comes with a 1kg spool of the same filament we use every day. You can add extra rolls of filament to your order… we’ve secured a very special price.

Who are Intops?

We have teamed up with one of Asia’s most experienced, precision manufacturing companies, Intops. Their Paper Program, which they fund along with the Industrial Bank of Korea (IBK), supports technology-competitive hardware startups in bringing their products to the market. Some projects brought to life by the Paper Program on Indiegogo include MicroBot Push and Embrace.This competitive program helps us with the design, development, and the manufacturing process of LOCOOP Y. This early recognition of our work by industry experts makes us confident that we can deliver LOCOOP Y to you by the end of 2016.

Do I need a Ph.D. in mechanical engineering to maintain LOCOOP Y?

Heck no! We’ve got Ph.D.s in physics and we do just fine. All joking aside, LOCOOP Y does not use carrier rails, freeing it from many of the wear and tear and alignment issues of cartesian and linear delta printers. We’ve built LOCOOP Y with industry grade technology will keep printing just like it did on day one, for many years to come.

How easy is LOCOOP Y to assemble?

While we (Induk and Yeo Myung) might be rocket scientists, you do NOT need a degree in astrophysics to assemble LOCOOP Y. It assembles in minutes and comes out of the box in three sections. All complicated electronics and mechanical parts come fully assembled before delivery. That means no wasted weekends trying to put it together.

Where can I find the prints you used on this page?

The printed samples in our Indiegogo page were made by fantastically talented individuals in the maker community that use 3d printers like LOCOOP Y. 

Many Thanks to:

It also runs on half the energy consumption of a conventional 3D printer.With every printer we will include a 1 kg spool of filament and a 4GB SD card. 



Help us deliver LOCOOP Y to you!
We've got two working prototypes printing and testing non-stop right now, but we need your help to ramp up production and deliver LOCOOP Y to you. Your support in our Indiegogo campaign will help us commercialize the world's first 'original delta' 3D printer.











We were inspired by the Delta Robot, invented in the 1980s by Swiss Professor Reymond Clavel. Three individually operated arms move with incredible precision controlling the robot's head.
LOCOOP Y is the first 3D printer to bring this technology to mass market. 
Cartesian and linear delta 3D printers need to keep constant tension on carrier rails. This causes friction that leads to faster wear and tear on vital components. LOCOOP Y doesn't have carrier rails. Instead, its arms move in precise circular patterns, increasing reliability over the long-term.
 







The most common error that plagues 3D printers is layer shift. It happens as Cartesian and linear delta printers gradually lose tension on their carrier rails.
Based on our experience, layer shift is most likely to occur three-quarters of the way through a big print, when you're on a tight deadline.
By eliminating carrier rails on the LOCOOP Y, we've also eliminated layer shift.








Industrial machines are used thousands if not millions of times a day and stay reliable. We asked ourselves, "Why can't 3D printers be the same?"
The three-armed Delta Robot that inspired our Original Delta technology is used in industries where precision is mission critical, including packaging, high precision assembly, pharmaceuticals, and even in surgeries.
LOCOOP Y has a 50 micron printing resolution, but more importantly, it maintains that level of precision over time. We've run prints up to 48 hours with no print errors.











Large Door: LOCOOP Y’s huge front facing door makes it easy to remove even the largest of prints.

Extra-Large Removable Bed: The polycarbonate surface is specially textured to make sure prints adhere well, stay flat, and don't curl up at the edges. The bed also comes out easily so that you can remove objects without damaging them. 


Memory Card Slot: Transfer your designs easily to LOCOOP Y by using a memory card up to 4GB. That's four times the memory supported by most 3D printers.


Less Energy Consumption: At just 60 Watts, LOCOOP Y uses half the energy of a conventional 3D Printer, making it super efficient and environment friendly. Think of what this would mean for a lab or school running multiple printers at the same time.


Open Source "CURA" Compatibility: LOCOOP Y is compatible with the CURA interface that you already know and love. (It's the most popular open-source slicer available!) Nothing new to learn. Start exporting G-code immediately.















Need extra filament? You can add extra rolls of the filament we use every day for our prints at LOCOOP. We've secured a very special price of just $25. (Only valid as an add-on when you order LOCOOP Y.)

Comprised of a Ph.D of Science in Astronomy from Seoul National University, and a Ph.D of Science in Physics from KAIST, the founding team is passionate about using technology to realize creative ideas. 
We want to make 3D printing easy, to make it available for everyone as a tool to materialize their creations; and ultimately to 3D print homes on Mars.




We have teamed up with one of Asia’s most experienced, precision manufacturing companies, Intops. They help us with the design, development, and the manufacturing process of LOCOOP Y. Their Paper Program, which they fund along with the Industrial Bank of Korea (IBK), supports technology-competitive hardware startups in bringing their products to the market. Some projects brought to life by the Paper Program on Indiegogo include; MicroBot Push and Embrace. This early recognition of our work by industry experts makes us confident that we can deliver LOCOOP Y to you by the end of 2016.

What are the shipping costs?
Shipping rates range from $10 to $250. Please check the specific rate and tariffs for your country.
• South Korea: $10• East Asia, South East Asia: $80• North America, Oceania, India: $90• Europe: $130• Rest of the world: $250
What is your refund policy?
We’re keeping things in accordance with Indiegogo Standards and unfortunately cannot offer refunds. BUT! if there are perk changes or if there’s some mixing and matching you’d like to do, please contact us at preorder@locoop.net. 
How far along are you in design and production? Where will LOCOOP Y be assembled?
We’re primed and ready for launch! Right now we’re working with our manufacturing partner, Intops, to finalize production. We’re putting LOCOOP Y together in the same high tech, precision factories that Intops uses to produce smartphones and accessories in Korea. Their Paper Program for hardware startups have a proven track record and we’re excited to see the original LOCOOP Y’s brothers and sisters all over the world.
How can you make these printers so affordable?
Thanks for the compliment! The printer uses fewer components than others because it uses industry-inspired Original Delta Technology. This makes it more affordable and more reliable. Our relationship with our manufacturing partner, Intops, means that we can source and assemble the best components at a competitive cost.
When will my printer arrive? 
As soon as possible! We’re targeting a December 2016 ship date. The exact arrival date will depend on country, customs, or delivery status.
What comes with the printer? 
Every printer comes with a 1 kg spool of filament, a 4GB SD card and a 100-240V 60W power adapter.
What slicers are compatible with LOCOOP Y?
LOCOOP Y is compatible with CURA, an open source slicer that has become incredibly popular because it is so easy and intuitive to use. 
How much set up does LOCOOP Y need before I make my first print?
Setup couldn’t be easier with LOCOOP Y. Use the touchscreen on LOCOOP Y and it will auto level the bed, warm up your filament and initiate printing! It’s that easy!
How big is LOCOOP Y?
LOCOOP Y is 50cm wide x 47cm deep and 60cm high. We prefer the phrase ‘big and beautiful’
 What filament diameter can LOCOOP Y use?
LOCOOP Y uses the standard 1.75mm PLA filament. It will extrude any PLA filament of this diameter.
 What types of filaments can I use?
We have tested LOCOOP Y to run with 1.75mm PLA for the best results. LOCOOP Y comes with a 1kg spool of the same filament we use every day. You can add extra rolls of filament to your order… we’ve secured a very special price.
Who are Intops?
We have teamed up with one of Asia’s most experienced, precision manufacturing companies, Intops. Their Paper Program, which they fund along with the Industrial Bank of Korea (IBK), supports technology-competitive hardware startups in bringing their products to the market. Some projects brought to life by the Paper Program on Indiegogo include MicroBot Push and Embrace.This competitive program helps us with the design, development, and the manufacturing process of LOCOOP Y. This early recognition of our work by industry experts makes us confident that we can deliver LOCOOP Y to you by the end of 2016.
Do I need a Ph.D. in mechanical engineering to maintain LOCOOP Y?
Heck no! We’ve got Ph.D.s in physics and we do just fine. All joking aside, LOCOOP Y does not use carrier rails, freeing it from many of the wear and tear and alignment issues of cartesian and linear delta printers. We’ve built LOCOOP Y with industry grade technology will keep printing just like it did on day one, for many years to come.
How easy is LOCOOP Y to assemble?
While we (Induk and Yeo Myung) might be rocket scientists, you do NOT need a degree in astrophysics to assemble LOCOOP Y. It assembles in minutes and comes out of the box in three sections. All complicated electronics and mechanical parts come fully assembled before delivery. That means no wasted weekends trying to put it together.
Where can I find the prints you used on this page?
The printed samples in our Indiegogo page were made by fantastically talented individuals in the maker community that use 3d printers like LOCOOP Y. 
Many Thanks to:

story:
The Re-Invent Democracy web technology will give the 2.4 billion people who use the web a virtual "vote" in real time on any national or transnational issue, crisis, conflict, policy or election, at any place, any time, across any distance.

Q&A for the Re-Invent Democracy Team

Question: What is your mission?

Our mission is to accelerate the evolution of democratic forms of government as they incorporate advanced information technology, telecommunications and social networks.

In particular, we plan to use our Re-Invent Democracy Web Technology to solve a public sector crisis that the public sector is unable to solve - the global governance crisis - by enabling voters across the political spectrum to build consensus and end conflicts that far too many governments are failing to resolve.

This global governance crisis is jeopardizing progress on virtually every front. It stems from the failure of governing institutions and lawmakers to devise effective solutions to life-threatening crises and conflicts in a manner that serves the public interest and responds to their constituents' needs and demands.

It also stems from the disconnect between lawmakers and their constituents, and the increasing tensions and confrontations occurring between them. Small numbers of lawmakers enact laws for millions of people who often encounter insurmountable obstacles when they try to use electoral and legislative processes to determine who is elected and what laws are passed.

Our goal is to ensure that governments and elected officials serve the people they represent. Right now, far too many governments around the world are disconnected from the people they should be representing because lawmakers put the demands of special interests ahead of the needs of their constituents. 

The Re-Invent Democracy Web Technology enables people to take direct action to overcome this disconnect and replace failing governments with governments elected by and for the people. It empowers people from all walks of life to join forces to set common agendas and build winning voting blocs and coalitions that are large enough to decide who runs for office, who gets elected and what laws are passed.

The technology provides voters across the political and ideological spectrum access to a common website, reinventdemocracy.net, where they can meet online to build consensus about legislative priorities and solutions to any problem, crisis or conflict occurring at any level, within and across national boundaries.

All they will have to do to use the technology free of charge on this website is to create an account by providing a screen-name and a valid email address. Then they can set up their individual home page and obtain an internal email address so they can get started setting their agendas and connecting with like-minded voters with similar agendas.

Voters will be able to take the lead in consensus building, in concert, if they wish, with lawmakers, political parties, electoral candidates, issue groups, unions and civil society organizations of their choice. Together, they can form transpartisan online voting blocs and coalitions that cross partisan lines around transpartisan agendas for solving any problems, crises and conflicts they wish to address.

By building consensus on the part of ever larger numbers of voters across the political and ideological spectrum, blocs and coalitions can create transpartisan electoral bases larger than the electoral base of any single political party. By so doing, blocs and coalitions can run and elect their own slates of candidates to enact their agendas. If they decide their elected representatives have failed to exert their best efforts to enact bloc and coalition agendas, they can run new slates of candidates to replace them in forthcoming elections.

To fulfill this mission, we plan to build the world's first large scale consensus building and conflict resolution platform. Our social networking website, reinventdemocracy.net, will merge social media and politics to meet the unmet needs of the nearly three billion people who use social networks.

Surveys indicate a surge of worldwide discontent with elected officials and governments that are locked in political stalemates and conflicts and and put the demands of special interests ahead of the public interest. The platform will enable those who are losing faith in democratic electoral and legislative processes to reform and re-invent them by inserting new voter-controlled consensus-building structures into these processes that can work with lawmakers to devise workable solutions.

Our goal is empower voters to re-invent failing democracies by overcoming the disconnect between ordinary people around the world and their governments. Most people have little say in government decisions affecting their lives and well-being.

Unfortunately, this disconnect is leading to government-caused stalemates, crises and conflicts, within and across national borders, which are making it increasingly difficult for people to obtain jobs that pay living wages and afford the basic necessities of life. These difficulties are largely due to the fact that elected representatives tend to put the laws demanded by special interests ahead of the needs of their constituents. This is most likely to occur when lawmakers depend on special interest money to get elected, which is the case with the large majority of U.S. lawmakers.

We think this technology will prove especially useful in countries like the U.S. where minority rule by special interests has paralyzed the federal government in Washington, D.C.

Legislative gridlock in the U.S. Congress is largely caused by uncompromising partisan conflicts among special interests, political parties and party representatives, while the needs of ordinary people and the public interest are ignored.

The unique Re-Invent Democracy technology can overcome these conflicts by enabling entire electorates to get control of elections and legislation. Voters can build consensus online around legislative agendas specifying what they want government to do, or not to do. They can email their priorities to their elected representatives and mandate them to enact their agendas or risk defeat in the next election. If they decide to vote against their elected representatives in the next election, they can build winning voting blocs and electoral coalitions to run and elect their own candidates.

We are seeking $500,000 to fund the first stage of developing our technology into the world's first large scale consensus building and conflict resolution platform. We will use the funds to develop and test the user-friendliness of our implementation of the technology in three prototypes. They include two global democracy building and social networking websites, as well as an online multi-party game of electoral strategy that shows players how to use the technology.

Together, these offerings will provide voters the tools they need to get control of electoral and legislative processes.  They will be able to build winning online voting blocs and coalitions large enough to elect lawmakers without special interest funding to enact legislation that meets their needs rather than the demands of special interests.

Question: What is the technology?

Answer: The technology includes the recently patented Interactive Voter Choice System and the System for Playing an Interactive Voter Choice Game.

We plan to make this technology available on the reinventdemocracy.net website and the reinventdemocracyfoundation.net website.

Question: How does the technology work?

Answer: It enables voters to build voting blocs and electoral coalitions that comprise broad cross-sections of the electorate and can acquire more political influence than political parties.

These blocs and coalitions, which can comprise and align with political parties, can build electoral bases that surpass the voting strength of political parties and their ability to elect candidates of their choice.

Here's how:
  • Voters can use the technology to set their legislative agendas, connect with voters with similar agendas and form online voting blocs and electoral coalitions with like-minded voters.
  • Bloc and coalition members can vote on common agendas and common slates of candidates.
  • They can reach out to voters across the political and ideological spectrum to negotiate common legislative agendas that cross partisan and ideological lines.
  • Blocs and coalitions with transpartisan agendas can build transpartisan electoral bases with greater numbers of voting members than the electoral bases of any single political party.
  • Blocs and coalitions can use these electoral bases to elect their own slates of candidates, and hold their elected representatives accountable at the ballot box for enacting bloc and coalition agendas.

Our online multi-party game of electoral strategy shows players how to build winning voting blocs and coalitions.

Question: How do these voting blocs and coalitions compare to political parties?

Answer: There are three major differences:
  • Bloc and coalition members can vote on bloc and coalition agendas and slates of candidates, in contrast to parties that do not permit their members to vote on their agendas and slates of candidates before they are on the ballot.
  • Bloc and coalition agendas do not have to conform to particular ideologies or party lines and can include voters across the political and ideological spectrum.
  • Since blocs and coalitions can build larger transpartisan electoral bases than the electoral base of a single party, bloc and coalition candidates can defeat party candidates and win without special interest campaign contributions.

Parties and candidates typically limit voters' choices to voting for or against candidates already on the ballot who are running on agendas over which voters have little influence.

In contrast, blocs and coalitions that use our technology, acting independently or in alliance with political parties, can run their own slates of candidates on ballot lines of their choosing.

Another difference is that political parties divide voters across partisan lines, while our technology unites voters across the political and ideological spectrum around transpartisan voting blocs, coalitions, agendas and electoral bases that cross partisan lines.

Question: How does the technology promote consensus building?

In order to grow large enough to win elections, our technology motivates blocs and coalitions to continuously reach out to new voters to build consensus. They can use it to open dialogues with prospective new bloc and coalition members an to discuss, debate and vote on common agendas and slates of candidates.  This drive to increase bloc and coalition voting strength encourages continuous consensus building by ever larger numbers of voters working together to set common legislative agendas.

Technically speaking, the technology's electronic data processing capabilities make it possible to connect voters, elected representatives, candidates, policy makers, and members of political parties, issue groups and non-governmental organizations online on a scale never before possible.  By discussing, debating and voting on agendas to resolve political problems, crises and conflicts, they can build large multi-stakeholder  voting blocs and electoral coalitions around common agendas and run and elect common slates of candidates.

Question: What are the ultimate goals of the technology, websites and game?

Answer: The goals are to enable voters and democracy stakeholders around the world to replace minority rule by special interests with majority rule by injecting voter-controlled consensus building structures and processes into elections and legislative decision-making.

These structures and processes will enable them to put an end to the political stalemates and legislative gridlock caused by constant in-fighting among special interests, political parties and politicians. The reason they can do so is because they can grow transpartisan electoral bases large enough to defeat incumbents by running and electing their own candidates.

Question: Could failing democracies be reformed through traditional legislative and legal channels instead of relying on technology?

Answer: This is unlikely because democracies have fallen prey to deeply embedded obstructions in the form of campaign finance and election laws, etc. that prevent their electorates from deciding who runs for office, who gets elected, and what laws are passed.

The large majority of lawmakers who use these obstructions to get elected would be unlikely to pass laws to overturn them -- especially U.S. laws and court decisions like Citizens United that allow special interests to make virtually unlimited contributions to political campaigns.

Question: What is the impact of these obstructions?

Answer:
  • Rigged elections.
  • Excessive partisanship on the part of uncompromising special interests, political parties and elected officials.
  • Legislative stalemates and gridlock caused by the refusal of lawmakers in opposing camps to resolve disagreements and conflicts in order to pass needed legislation.
  • Lawmakers' passage of laws that favor the interests of their special interest campaign contributors rather than those of their constituents.

Question: Can the Re-Invent Demcocracy web technology be used to solve transnational conflicts?

Answer: Yes, the technology enables voters to build transnational voting blocs and coalitions to solve transnational problems, crises and conflicts.

These transnational  blocs and coalitions can win elections in multiple countries by having their members create blocs, coalitions in their home country to elect lawmakers who pledge to enact the agendas of their transnational blocs and coalitions.

Blocs and coalitions can also influence decisions by their executive branches of government when they grow large enough to determine the outcome of future elections.

Question: Who is behind the Re-Invent Democracy web technology?

Answer: An international team of technologists, entrepreneurs and social scientists with public and private sector experience and roots in Denmark, the Netherlands, Switzerland and the U.S. (See list and biographies of team members below.)

The team is led by web entrepreneur and political scientist Nancy Bordier, Ph.D., who holds dual Swiss and U.S. citizenship.  She is the inventor of the Interactive Voter Choice System and the System for Playing an Interactive Voter Choice Game. She is also the founder and CEO of Re-Invent Democracy, Inc. and the Re-Invent Democracy Foundation Intl.

You can read her personal political story below describing the political events that led her to invent the technology.

Question: What do contributors to this campaign receive in exchange for their contributions?

Answer: The ultimate perk, when the reinventdemocracy.net website is fully developed, will be free access to the technology's agenda setting, political organizing and consensus building tools for building winning voting blocs and electoral coalitions.

Immediate perks include:
  • Membership in the Re-Invent Democracy Community hosted on the Re-Invent Democracy Foundation's global democracy building website, reinventdemocracyfoundation.net.
  • Membership in the Re-Invent Democracy Community hosted on the Re-Invent Democracy Foundation's global democracy building website.
  • Inclusion of the names of contributors in the Re-Invent Democracy Who's Who that will be published on the Foundation website.
  • Membership in the Foundation's e-Democracy Technology Consortium.
  • Subscription to the Citizens' Winning Hands® Game when it is completed.
  • Lifetime membership on the Re-Invent Democracy Foundation Intl Advisory Board.

Implementing the Technology

To ensure the technology provides trustworthy tools, the Re-Invent Democracy team is assembling an international team of developers to build and operate the platform in Switzerland.  It is a neutral country in the heart of Europe with strict privacy laws and advanced encryption technologies.

The team is taking a three-pronged approach to implementing the technology. It is developing and testing the user-friendliness of prototypes of two global democracy building and social networking websites, as well as an online multi-party game of electoral strategy that shows players how to use the technology's agenda setting, political organizing and consensus building tools.

The two websites are the reinventdemocracy.net website and the reinventdemocracyfoundation .net website. The game is the Citizens' Winning Hands® Game, a multi-party online game of electoral strategy to be developed around the System for Playing an Interactive Voter Choice Game, a companion technology to the Interactive Voter Choice System.

REINVENTDEMOCRACY.NET

The reinventdemocracy.net website is being built around the core features of the  Interactive Voter Choice System contained in the patent issued by the U.S. Patent and Trademark Office (U.S. Patent No. 7,953,628).

It comprises a "computer based network", a "website on the Internet," and "computerized databases of objects, each object representing a stance on a policy option of concern to voters." The system, which creates "aggregates of voters with similar preferred policy options", is designed to enable voters to "build consensus, coalitions and voting blocs that can run and elect their own candidates for office and induce elected representatives to enact their agendas."

The system is unique in terms of its potential to connect democracy building stakeholders across the political and ideological spectrum, including electorates, elected representatives, electoral candidates, political parties, issue groups and non-governmental organizations around the world.

For the first time in history, virtually unlimited numbers of individual stakeholders will be able to  connect to each other on a continuous basis; set their agendas, individually and collectively, across the board and partisan lines; and build transpartisan voting blocs, electoral coalitions and electoral bases that can elect lawmakers to enact their agendas.

Moreover, the technology possesses an inherent incentive and unprecedented potential to unite voters rather than divide them as political parties do, because it will connect multiple groups of stakeholders who might otherwise be divided along partisan lines.  They will be united by their goal of ensuring majority rule by building transpartisan blocs and coalitions from the "bottom up" by sharing their ideas, knowledge and needs while negotiating and voting on the priorities to be included in common transpartisan agendas. 

Thanks to this on-going consensus building process, the members of these blocs and coalitions will become more numerous and as well-informed as the small number of elected representatives and policy makers authorized to enact legislation and policies. When these officials receive mandates from blocs and coalitions, they will recognize that the mandates have been formulated by people who are as knowledgeable as they are, and possibly even more knowledgeable, because the mandates come from the grassroots and the people most affected by the legislation and policies in question.

People, groups and organizations can choose their priorities in several ways, including composing their own priorities specifying the legislation they want to see enacted, as well as by using customized databases that will be accessible online on the reinventdemocracy.net website.

Elected representatives, electoral candidates and political parties will also be able to use the technology to poll their constituents and supporters on a continuous basis to find out what their priorities are.  They will be able to use the website to engage their supporters in discussing, debating and voting on their agendas.

Representatives and candidates who succeed in generating widespread support for common legislative agendas that they set with their supporters will be able to forge winning electoral bases of voting constituents without special interest financing. Elected representatives who know what their constituents want, and honor their constituents' priorities rather than those of special interests, will be able to cast their votes in legislative bodies without conflicts of interest.

For example, if you are a member of any of these stakeholder groups, you can:
  • Set your own agenda of priorities regarding legislation you want lawmakers to enact.
  • Connect with people who have similar priorities in locations of your choice.
  • Join forces with like-minded democracy stakeholders to build voting blocs and electoral coalitions to discuss, debate and use the technology's voting utility to vote on common agendas, and pressure incumbent lawmakers to enact your agendas.
  • Nominate and elect your own candidates to replace lawmakers that your blocs and coalitions judge to have failed to exert their best efforts to enact the legislative mandates you have given them.

There are four ways your blocs and coalitions will be able to use the reinventdemocracy.net website to pressure lawmakers into enacting your agendas and hold them accountable if they fail to do so.

You can:
  • Conduct large scale petitioning campaigns; use the voting utility to tally the number of signatories; transmit the petition to lawmakers electronically; and publicize the results via media of your choice.
  • Conduct online referendums that convey to your representatives your  immediate legislative priorities, using the voting utility to tally the number of votes cast to show them how many people advocate these priorities.
  • Conduct online straw recall votes to inform representatives and policy-makers who fail to exert their best efforts to enact your agendas and mandates how many people want to oust them from office immediately.
  • Defeat in actual elections lawmakers whose legislative track records are deemed unsatisfactory by your blocs and coalitions.

REINVENTDEMOCRACYFOUNDATION.NET

The reinventdemocracyfoundation.net website is being developed by the Re-Invent Democracy Foundation Intl to create a global community of democracy builders.

The goal is to increase the use of democracy building technologies to strengthen democratic forms of government around the world and overcome their vulnerability to obstructions that prevent majority rule.

This global community will comprise people from all geographical areas and walks of life, across the political and ideological spectrum.

It will include voters, elected representatives, policy-makers, members of political parties, issue groups, civil society organizations and international agencies that work nationally and transnationally.

The Foundation will encourage these stakeholders to play pro-active roles in utilizing web-based technologies that enable ever larger numbers of people to participate actively in electoral and legislative processes.

The Foundation's ultimate objective is to enable democracy stakeholders to elect governments and lawmakers who will enact legislation and policies that serve the majority will and the public interest.

The website and community will provide you a variety of opportunities for communicating with the Re-Invent Democracy team and your fellow democracy-builders around the world. You will also be invited to share with us your views about the technology-based tools and services that will be provided to you free of charge on reinventdemocracy.net when it is fully developed, and ways and means to improve their effectiveness.

Interactive features such as the Re-Invent Democracy Community Blog, the Re-Invent Democracy Founders' Blog and The Democracy Exchange will facilitate dialogue, debate and exchange of information about challenges to majority rule in specific locations, and ways and means to use democracy building technologies to address these challenges.

In addition, the Foundation's E-Democracy Technology Consortium will provide technology developers opportunities to work with each other, democracy builders around the world, and the Re-Invent Democracy team to evaluate the effectiveness of existing and emerging technologies.

The team will be inviting feedback and input from these groups as it seeks to enhance and integrate state-of-the-art and emerging technologies into the reinventdemocracy.net platform -- especially advanced technologies that protect user privacy. The Foundation will strive to become a global leader in facilitating the utilization of the most advanced encryption technologies.

THE CITIZENS WINNING HANDS® GAME

The Citizens' Winning Hands® Game is multi-party online game of electoral strategy that is being developed around the System for Playing an Interactive Voter Choice Game,  a companion technology to the Interactive Voter Choice System. It is called the Citizens' Winning Hands® Game because it is designed around two decks of cards.

The game will enable voters to learn how to use the agenda-setting, political organizing, and consensus building tools of the Interactive Voter Choice System to form winning voting blocs and coalitions around common agendas and slates of candidates.

A World Changing Game

The game belongs to a new genre of "world-changing" online games where players develop real world skills for making the world a better place by collaborating online.

The renowned game developer, Jane McGonigal, points out that many of the 500 million people who play online games every day — especially massively multi-player online games — prefer games of collaboration and camaraderie to games of warfare and aggression.

She observes that these players are creating a global "collective intelligence" about ways and means by which ordinary people like themselves can dramatically improve the quality of human life and solve societal problems that cause preventable physical and emotional suffering.

McGonigal believes that many people play world-saving games because real world environments and institutions deny them the power to be heroic. Participation in these games adds meaning and happiness to players' imaginary lives by enabling them to make valuable contributions to their communities.

While they are playing these games, they are developing interpersonal skills that they can put to use in the real world to play collaborative pro-active roles that enable them to join forces with legions of other people to solve problems causing human suffering.

The Citizens' Winning Hands® Game belongs to this genre of world-saving game because it shows disillusioned voters who are losing faith in failing democracies and elections how they can collaborate online to assure majority rule by building voting blocs and electoral coalitions large enough to win elections.

By playing the game, they will have an opportunity to see that the Interactive Voter Choice System enables entire electorates to get control of electoral and legislative processes and elect representatives who will enact their legislative mandates.

THE RE-INVENT DEMOCRACY STORY
by Nancy Bordier

A Rude Awakening

The story of the Re-invent Democracy web technology begins back in 2004 when I attended a campaign event for a U.S. presidential primary candidate. Six months earlier when the candidate first threw his hat into the ring, he advocated priorities similar to my own.

But as soon as he started to raise campaign funds from special interests, he drifted farther and farther away from his original priorities towards those of the special interests. He lowered the priorities of early supporters and actual voters like myself down on his list of priorities in order to make room at the top for the priorities of his special interest contributors.

But as soon as he started to raise campaign funds from special interests, he drifted farther and farther away from his original priorities towards those of the special interests. He lowered the priorities of early supporters and actual voters like myself down on his list of priorities in order to make room at the top for the priorities of his special interest contributors.

When the candidate teleconferenced into the campaign event I was attending and started hedging on his priorities without giving us a chance to articulate our own, I came to a sudden and unexpected realization.
