story:
Imagine feeling the exhilaration of 10,000 vertical feet, fresh powder spraying from your newly sharpened edges, as you sail down the mountain on a picture-perfect winter day - all while giving to a child in need.

Welcome to Agent Outerwear.

For every coat purchased, we donate a brand new coat to a child in need. We like to call it, "Get Warm. Give Warm.®" and we want to give away as many coats as possible.

We are excited about the outdoors, especially snowsports. We love great design. But most importantly, whether it's work or play, we want it to mean something. That is why we've dedicated our business to serving others the best way we know how. 

For many children whose families don't have the means to supply them with a quality winter coat, being in school is the warmest part of their day. In many areas of the country, the winters are severe enough to make a walk to school painful, if not impossible without proper winter attire.

While coat donation drives help with the issue, the total donations received annually only scratch the surface for helping the amount of children in need.

Here at Agent Outerwear, it is our goal to create a sustainable solution to this problem.


We are seeking your help to fund our inventory purchase of our fully developed line of coats and fleeces. All we have left to do to make this dream a reality is to make the purchase. Being able to supply inventory for sale means that we will be able to supply coats for kids, and that's really what we're here to do.

But we don't expect you to just give us the money! We have some awesome deals, specially priced for this campaign. 

And with every donation for a hat, fleece jacket or coat, we will donate one to a child in need.

Here is your chance to get Agent gear at  incredible savings!


For more details about our products, we invite you to visit agentouterwear.com.

Please be sure to select the correct size fleece or coat for your perk. 

Look for the Agent Outerwear Promise® on select product pages, and let us do the rest.   

When you purchase a coat from Agent Outerwear, you become a totally rad Agent of Giving.® Not only can you rock the slopes with your technologically advanced gear, but  wearing the Agent brand tells the world that you are a socially conscious consumer, and you demand genuine integrity in the brands you choose to support. 

We hope to inspire and change the way the world does business. Not only do we want to provide our customers with an amazing and functional product, but we want our success to be measured in how many children we can help with our mission.


Throughout our campaign, we will be featuring several contests and special offers to our donators, including gift certificates and extra free gear! If you would like to be kept up to date on upcoming contests and specials, send us your email address at info@agentouterwear.com and we'll put you on our email blast list. 

We have some exciting things in store for you!

_________________________________________________________



While we are initially seeking $15,000 to get our mission started, we will be in need of additional funding to place our first inventory order, at a minimum of $35,000. Our ultimate goal is $75,000 to get us ready for the 2014-15 winter sports season with additional coat and fleece styles. 

If we cannot reach our minimum goal of $35,000, we will be unable to place a production order for the above perks and all of your donated funds will be returned to you. 

If we successfully reach our goal, we hope to have all of your perks shipped by September 1, 2014. Hats and stickers will ship by April 1, 2014. Children's donations will be made at our first Giving Event. For more information about how we make our donations, please visit the Our Mission page at agentouterwear.com.

At this time, we are also considering investors as a funding source. If you would like more information about joining Agent Outerwear as an investor, please email lindsay@agentouterwear.com for more details. 


We want to talk to you! If you have any questions about our products, mission or funding campaign, or ideas on how to make it better, please let us know. You can email us any time at info@agentouterwear.com.


The best thing you can do to help: please share our mission!

Here are some ways you can help us without spending a single dime:

  • Share our campaign with your friends and family on Facebook and Twitter.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to help boost our Gogo Factor to help us get featured on the site!
  • Post a link to our campaign or website on your favorite blog, forum or group page for people you think might be interested.
  • Like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter and interact with our awesome community of people who support our work.
  • Send us your email address at info@agentouterwear.com to stay up to date on new products, the latest campaign updates and special offers.


We thank you for your interest and support. Your time and donations mean everything to us, and because of you, there will be one less child without a coat this winter!

story:
A limited edition, incredibly unique, luxury timepiece designed by MMA Legend Georges St. Pierre and Egard Watch Company. 

  

 

 

Georges Favorite Design Features:  

  • Engraved Signature Caseback  
  • Engraved Superman Punch  
  • Revolving Disks Complications  
  • Fleur De Lis on Watch Crown  

Ilan's Favorite Design Features:  

  • Curved Sapphire Crystal on the top and bottom
  • 2 Piece Trademarked Oblong Case  
  • Modified Automatic Movement  
  • New AA Plating Method

Why Crowdfunding

The Rush watch is currently pre-selling on Indiegogo. This lets us cut out the distributors and wholesalers to offer the piece at over 50% discount for a limited time and get feedback directly from you, the customer! If you love the Rush timepiece now is the time to get in on this amazing watch!

Due to an amazing reception of the Rush timepiece we have opted to add Superluminova on disks as a bonus to all our supporters!

 

We opted to create Rush in two different movements and pricing categories with subtle differences between the two.

  

Our high-quality quartz watch allows for an affordable option, while our automatic has a build quality only seen in high-end luxury boutique brands.  

  • Automatic — A mechanical watch (modified Miyota 9100) where the mainspring is wound automatically by motion, providing energy to power the watch. The automatic Rush uses sapphire crystal. 
  • Quartz — A battery operated watch that uses an entelectronic oscillator that is regulated by a quartz crystal to keep time. The quartz Rush uses a hardened mineral crystal and has chronograph functions instead of the Day/Date/Month features found on the automatic version.

No matter what movement you choose, this luxurious timepiece is the perfect daily reminder of strength and precision in and out of the ring.

 

Georges 'Rush' St. Pierre is one of the greatest and most accomplished fighters in MMA history, a legend.

Georges is a mixed martial artist and a three year champion of UFC, having won the title in 2006 and 2008, as well as an Interim title in 2007 and most recently the middleweight title against Michael Bisping.  

He is often cited as the greatest MMA fighter of all time and the most accomplished in history. Georges retired in 2013, holding the record for most wins in title bouts and the second longest combined title streak in UFC history (2,204 days).  

Georges has always dreamed of creating a watch that symbolized his career as a lifetime mixed martial artist and UFC champion, so I reached out more than willing to help him realize this dream.

A Timepiece Designed with the Qualities of a Champion:  

Thanks to the creative and design input from Georges, our collaboration is truly one of a kind and sure to become an iconic, limited edition collector's piece in the future.

After many meetings, our final collaborative vision was to create a timepiece with accuracy, timing, precision, and power—all qualities of both a champion fighter and a luxurious timepiece:  

  • Accuracy — Its 28,800 vibrations per hour, 26 jewels, and its modified Miyota 9100 made this piece incredibly accurate.  
  • Timing — A battery-free, automatic movement is made for reliability, years of use, and powered by natural wrist movement.  
  • Precision — A complicated, modified automatic movement displays 7 disc dials efficiently and accurately.   
  • Power — The reserve power indicator displays how much charge is left in your Rush watch for up to 42 hours.

My name is Ilan Srulovicz. I founded Egard Watch after designing my first watch as a tribute to my father in 2012.

I built Egard Watch Company on the principle that a watch is not something you simply put on your wrist but something far more precious.  

The first timepiece I designed was in 2010 for my father to honor the unbreakable bond between parent and child. It was my goal to create inspiring luxury pieces that embody the depth of emotion we each feel for the people in our lives who have defined our own important moments.

   

Egard's third collaboration in our tribute collection:  

Through the years, I've had the privilege to work with many actors, professional athletes, and artists to design custom timepieces with a few collaborations going into limited run productions.

  • Peter Srulovicz — In 2011, I designed a special timepiece as a tribute to my father. This was the official start of Egard Watch Co. and what I built the foundation of my watchmaking company on.  
  • William Shatner — In 2013, Bill and I initially designed his "Passages" timepiece as a gift to his grandchildren. Shortly thereafter we rolled out a 3,000 unit limited edition production run on Indiegogo driven by the demand of his fans.  
  • Georges St. Pierre — Carrying on the tradition started with Bill Shatner, Georges and I collaborated this year to create a commemorative watch that would honor his legacy in the sport of mixed martial arts.  

Still to this day, my father and I work in our Los Angeles and Toronto offices to design and manufacture all of Egard’s pieces together.

    

Accuracy, timing, precision, and power - all things needed in both a champion fighter and a luxurious watch.

Named after Georges "Rush" St. Pierre, this luxury timepiece is the perfect daily reminder of strength and precision in and out of the ring.

The effortless automatic movement, quality materials, and a one of a kind design is something GSP fans and watch fans alike will appreciate.

 

 

Unique Time Telling like no other watch.

The three center disks rotate and align to show the time with the outermost disk displaying minutes, the middle disk in hours, and the centermost disk in seconds.

Battery-Free Automatic Movement  

To create a unique way to tell time, Georges and I also collaborated directly with Miyota to modify their 9100 movement.

The Rush timepiece runs on a modified automatic movement, meaning it runs on the energy you create with no need for a battery or to be wound by hand.  

The Miyota 9100 is incredible; it's a hacking movement loaded with "complications" often not seen in a movement. We took an already complex design and modified it, switching out all the complications for disks.

Complex Rotating Disk Watch Dial  

Rather than ticking hands, the Rush disks rotate where the hands would normally be placed on the face of a watch.

The more complications on a mechanical timepiece the more intricate the building process. We had to modify Rush's movement to be able to support, carry, and move the added weight of the disks efficiently while still measuring time accurately.  

GSP's Rush is designed to be among the most elite, complicated watches. It offers incredibly layered complications: Time (center disk), Date (numerical indicator bottom right), Day (left disk), Month (right disk), Day/Night (sun or moon disk bottom center), and Power (top center needle).

Unique Curved Steel Watch Case  

The non-traditional curvature sets Rush apart from other luxury watches in both its feel and in its aesthetic.

 

Only available by Egard Watches, Rush's specially designed curved case fits the curve of your wrist perfectly, for a comfortable and distinct look.

One of the continued notes about this case is how well it conforms to your wrist. Regardless of wrist size, this piece maintains a perfect level of presence while still feeling incredibly comfortable because of how it wraps to the curvature of your own wrist.  

Further, the durable AA case plating method (10x thicker than the industry standard PVD plating) makes the Rush casing hard to scratch and is comprised of 100 microns compared to standard PVD at 5 to 10 microns.

 

Scratch Resistant Sapphire Crystal  

Rush is scratch resistant with our Sapphire Crystal design that is specially created to fit our unique curved case with low reflection.

Sapphire crystals are expensive, have to fit the case perfectly, while also not have to much refraction and reflection. To curve a Sapphire on both ends while addressing sizing, fit, and reflection is a technical nightmare. 

Luckily, we learned a technique on the William Shatner Passages collaboration and can now recreate this wonderful effect. As far as I know, we are the only ones making a sapphire crystal of this type.

Luxurious Genuine Leather Watchband  

Complementing the elegant watch face is a high-quality leather watch strap that brings the watch together to easily match with any style.

 

Rush's standard watch strap is not your average band; its luxurious high-quality leather looks great and feels great on your wrist. Depending on your style of choice, Rush comes with either a blue or black watch band that compliments each design.  

With the Rush Box Set upgrade (details below), you'll receive a gorgeous steel bracelet with carbon fiber highlights to match the watch face and a rubber sports strap.

    

Each Rush timepiece has a limited edition numbering case back honoring Georges' career while showcasing the watch's movement.

Unfortunately, to ensure accurate delivery, we cannot hand select numbers on a case by case basis.

Our choices in watch components are high quality to ensure a luxury timepiece, while maintaining everyday practicality.

   

Warranty on Rush:

We have a 2-year limited warranty on both the Automatic and Quartz Rush timepiece. It covers any issues and defects with the Egard watch.

 

Automatic Watch Specifications:

  • Size: 43mm  
  • Thickness:13.5mm  
  • Lug Width: 22mm 
  • Water Resistance: 50 meters 
  • Material: 316L Stainless Steel 
  • Plating: Egard's own AA method of plating which is 5 to 10 times thicker than the industry standard for PVD plating - making the piece more durable. 
  • Crystal: Curved Sapphire with AR coating on front and back. 
  • Strap: Top grade genuine leather (black or blue) 
  • Edition: Limited Edition to 3000 each color 
  • Movement: Modified Miyota 9100, 26 jewel movement 
  • Features: Rotating disks, Time, Day, Date, Month, AM/PM, Power Reserve indicator, Hacking, 42-hour reserve
 

Quartz Watch Specifications:

  • Size: 43mm  
  • Thickness: 9mm  
  • Lug Width: 22mm 
  • Water Resistance: 50 meters 
  • Material: 316L Stainless Steel 
  • Plating: Egard's own AA method of plating which is 5 to 10 times thicker than the industry standard for PVD plating - making the piece more durable. 
  • Crystal: Curved Mineral Crystal 
  • Strap: Top grade genuine leather (black or blue) 
  • Edition: Limited Edition to 3000 each color Movement: Miyota Chronograph Mvmt 
  • Features: Rotating disks, Chronograph function
  

 

The Rush Box Set includes Metal Carbon Fiber Bracelet, Rubber Engraved Strap, and a GSP Collectors Card.

  

Steel/Carbon Fiber Bracelet:

 

  

 

Rubber Engraved Wristband:

  

  

Georges and I initially met at mixed martial arts training a few years ago and got to know each other over the years.

After an intensive design phase between Georges and myself, Rush has been prototyped and is ready to begin a limited run production. 

 

  
  • AUGUST 2016 — I decided to talk to Georges about my passion for watches, discussing a few I've created in the past, and showed excited and wanted to create one.
  • NOVEMBER 2016 — Georges and I got together, started to discuss the fundamentals of horology and watchmaking. Our collaborative design process had begun. All these complications (the technical term for features) alone are something often not seen in a movement but to then take such a complex design and modify it to not have the traditional display of hands but instead rotating disk is incredibly difficult. We essentially switched out all the complications for disks.
  • DECEMBER 2016 — Our first prototype was finished and it did not work. I had a realization that the disks were too heavy for the movement which stopped it from keeping time and allowing the disks to rotate. These disks rotate where the hands would originally be displayed to show you the information in a different and more unique way. 
  • DECEMBER 2016 — Near the end of last year, I reached out to Miyota, we also began to also collaborate directly to modify their 9100 Movement to ensure 'Rush' could work as the way Georges and I designed it to. The disk posed certain difficulties such as placement and weight of the disks themselves (which the movement has to be strong enough to turn) which is why we worked directly with Miyota.
  • MARCH 2017 — Our second prototype was working perfectly and passed all our Quality Control! 
  • MAY 2017 — Georges made an announcement about 'Rush' at Tao in Las Vegas, which was the official start of the 'Rush' timepiece.
  • JUNE 2017 — Our final production model is complete and ready for my father and I to mass produce and deliver.

Power — The reserve power indicator displays how much charge is left in your Rush watch for up to 42 hours. My name is Ilan Srulovicz. I founded Egard Watch after designing my first watch as a tribute to my father in 2012.Ilan Srulovicz and his father, for whom the first watch was designed.I built Egard Watch Company on the principle that a watch is not something you simply put on your wrist but something far more precious.  The first timepiece I designed was in 2010 for my father to honor the unbreakable bond between parent and child. It was my goal to create inspiring luxury pieces that embody the depth of emotion we each feel for the people in our lives who have defined our own important moments.   Egard's third collaboration in our tribute collection:  Through the years, I've had the privilege to work with many actors, professional athletes, and artists to design custom timepieces with a few collaborations going into limited run productions.
Peter Srulovicz — In 2011, I designed a special timepiece as a tribute to my father. This was the official start of Egard Watch Co. and what I built the foundation of my watchmaking company on.  
William Shatner — In 2013, Bill and I initially designed his "Passages" timepiece as a gift to his grandchildren. Shortly thereafter we rolled out a 3,000 unit limited edition production run on Indiegogo driven by the demand of his fans.  
Georges St. Pierre — Carrying on the tradition started with Bill Shatner, Georges and I collaborated this year to create a commemorative watch that would honor his legacy in the sport of mixed martial arts.  Still to this day, my father and I work in our Los Angeles and Toronto offices to design and manufacture all of Egard’s pieces together.    Accuracy, timing, precision, and power - all things needed in both a champion fighter and a luxurious watch.Rush has unparalleled design aspects with special details commemorating Georges St. Pierre's career and designed by Ilan Srulavicz of the Egard Watch Co.Named after Georges "Rush" St. Pierre, this luxury timepiece is the perfect daily reminder of strength and precision in and out of the ring. The effortless automatic movement, quality materials, and a one of a kind design is something GSP fans and watch fans alike will appreciate.Rose: Gold/Rose (left) — Night: Steel/Black (center) — Stealth: Black/Black (right) Classic: Steel/White (left) — Aqua: Steel/Blue (right) Unique Time Telling like no other watch.The three center disks rotate and align to show the time with the outermost disk displaying minutes, the middle disk in hours, and the centermost disk in seconds.

Battery-Free Automatic Movement  
To create a unique way to tell time, Georges and I also collaborated directly with Miyota to modify their 9100 movement.
Rush does not need batteries or to be "hand wound" but uses your body's natural movements when worn to power itself.
The Rush timepiece runs on a modified automatic movement, meaning it runs on the energy you create with no need for a battery or to be wound by hand.  
The Miyota 9100 is incredible; it's a hacking movement loaded with "complications" often not seen in a movement. We took an already complex design and modified it, switching out all the complications for disks.
Complex Rotating Disk Watch Dial  
Rather than ticking hands, the Rush disks rotate where the hands would normally be placed on the face of a watch.
The rotating disks give Rush an entirely unique and individual look.
The more complications on a mechanical timepiece the more intricate the building process. We had to modify Rush's movement to be able to support, carry, and move the added weight of the disks efficiently while still measuring time accurately.  
GSP's Rush is designed to be among the most elite, complicated watches. It offers incredibly layered complications: Time (center disk), Date (numerical indicator bottom right), Day (left disk), Month (right disk), Day/Night (sun or moon disk bottom center), and Power (top center needle).
Unique Curved Steel Watch Case  
The non-traditional curvature sets Rush apart from other luxury watches in both its feel and in its aesthetic.

 
Only available by Egard Watches, Rush's specially designed curved case fits the curve of your wrist perfectly, for a comfortable and distinct look.
One of the continued notes about this case is how well it conforms to your wrist. Regardless of wrist size, this piece maintains a perfect level of presence while still feeling incredibly comfortable because of how it wraps to the curvature of your own wrist.  
Further, the durable AA case plating method (10x thicker than the industry standard PVD plating) makes the Rush casing hard to scratch and is comprised of 100 microns compared to standard PVD at 5 to 10 microns.
 
Scratch Resistant Sapphire Crystal  
Rush is scratch resistant with our Sapphire Crystal design that is specially created to fit our unique curved case with low reflection.
Rush's curved sapphire leverages the skills learned on William Shatner's "Passages" timepiece in 2013.
Sapphire crystals are expensive, have to fit the case perfectly, while also not have to much refraction and reflection. To curve a Sapphire on both ends while addressing sizing, fit, and reflection is a technical nightmare. 
Luckily, we learned a technique on the William Shatner Passages collaboration and can now recreate this wonderful effect. As far as I know, we are the only ones making a sapphire crystal of this type.
Luxurious Genuine Leather Watchband  
Complementing the elegant watch face is a high-quality leather watch strap that brings the watch together to easily match with any style.

 
Rush's standard watch strap is not your average band; its luxurious high-quality leather looks great and feels great on your wrist. Depending on your style of choice, Rush comes with either a blue or black watch band that compliments each design.  
With the Rush Box Set upgrade (details below), you'll receive a gorgeous steel bracelet with carbon fiber highlights to match the watch face and a rubber sports strap.
    

Each Rush timepiece has a limited edition numbering case back honoring Georges' career while showcasing the watch's movement.

Unfortunately, to ensure accurate delivery, we cannot hand select numbers on a case by case basis.

Our choices in watch components are high quality to ensure a luxury timepiece, while maintaining everyday practicality.
Check out the watchmaker's technical specifications for The Rush Watch by Georges St. Pierre and Egard Watch Co.
   
Warranty on Rush:
We have a 2-year limited warranty on both the Automatic and Quartz Rush timepiece. It covers any issues and defects with the Egard watch.
 
Automatic Watch Specifications:


Size: 43mm  

Thickness:13.5mm  

Lug Width: 22mm 

Water Resistance: 50 meters 

Material: 316L Stainless Steel 

Plating: Egard's own AA method of plating which is 5 to 10 times thicker than the industry standard for PVD plating - making the piece more durable. 

Crystal: Curved Sapphire with AR coating on front and back. 

Strap: Top grade genuine leather (black or blue) 

Edition: Limited Edition to 3000 each color 

Movement: Modified Miyota 9100, 26 jewel movement 

Features: Rotating disks, Time, Day, Date, Month, AM/PM, Power Reserve indicator, Hacking, 42-hour reserve

 
Quartz Watch Specifications:


Size: 43mm  

Thickness: 9mm  

Lug Width: 22mm 

Water Resistance: 50 meters 

Material: 316L Stainless Steel 

Plating: Egard's own AA method of plating which is 5 to 10 times thicker than the industry standard for PVD plating - making the piece more durable. 

Crystal: Curved Mineral Crystal 

Strap: Top grade genuine leather (black or blue) 

Edition: Limited Edition to 3000 each color Movement: Miyota Chronograph Mvmt 

Features: Rotating disks, Chronograph function

  
 


The Rush Box Set includes Metal Carbon Fiber Bracelet, Rubber Engraved Strap, and a GSP Collectors Card.

  
Steel/Carbon Fiber Bracelet:
 

  
 
Rubber Engraved Wristband:
  

  



Georges and I initially met at mixed martial arts training a few years ago and got to know each other over the years.
Early sketch of Georges and my design for Rush.
After an intensive design phase between Georges and myself, Rush has been prototyped and is ready to begin a limited run production. 
 
An initial CAD rendering of the 'Rush' design.
  

AUGUST 2016 — I decided to talk to Georges about my passion for watches, discussing a few I've created in the past, and showed excited and wanted to create one.

NOVEMBER 2016 — Georges and I got together, started to discuss the fundamentals of horology and watchmaking. Our collaborative design process had begun. All these complications (the technical term for features) alone are something often not seen in a movement but to then take such a complex design and modify it to not have the traditional display of hands but instead rotating disk is incredibly difficult. We essentially switched out all the complications for disks.

DECEMBER 2016 — Our first prototype was finished and it did not work. I had a realization that the disks were too heavy for the movement which stopped it from keeping time and allowing the disks to rotate. These disks rotate where the hands would originally be displayed to show you the information in a different and more unique way. 

DECEMBER 2016 — Near the end of last year, I reached out to Miyota, we also began to also collaborate directly to modify their 9100 Movement to ensure 'Rush' could work as the way Georges and I designed it to. The disk posed certain difficulties such as placement and weight of the disks themselves (which the movement has to be strong enough to turn) which is why we worked directly with Miyota.

MARCH 2017 — Our second prototype was working perfectly and passed all our Quality Control! 

MAY 2017 — Georges made an announcement about 'Rush' at Tao in Las Vegas, which was the official start of the 'Rush' timepiece.

JUNE 2017 — Our final production model is complete and ready for my father and I to mass produce and deliver.

story:
JellyBand  is an accessory which holds your earphones always on your neck and doesn’t let them  tangle in your pocket or bag.

How long do you wear your earphones during a day? And how many times do you take them out of your ears and how much time do you spend untangling them to put them back?

We have created an accessory, which makes your life with earphones easier - JellyBand.

It's easy to put your earphones into the band.


It’s easy to put the band with earphones on your neck.


It’s easy to untangle earphones after getting them from your pocket or bag.



JellyBand is compatible with flat and round wires.


We created a whole strap without additional components which helps to hold your earphones around your neck and reduces wobble that makes them fall out.

On the way to JellyBand as it is now, we tried different concepts and forms - with additional parts and without them.


The design we stopped at seems to us as very convenient one.



To begin the production of JellyBand we need at least $1000 and we would be very grateful for any contribution into our project.

story:
PREMIUM UNDERWEAR THAT CONFORMS TO YOUR BODY

Design & Style


SHEATH 2.0 is crafted for Men with active lifestyles. SHEATH Underwear is made to fit comfortably while providing improved functionality with dependable performance and protection throughout your day. 

SHEATH 2.0 Underwear uses a premium fabric blend designed to move in complete sync with your body. Our Underwear supports your MANhood, while cozily snuggled in the ample sized soft joey pouch. 

COLOR OPTIONS:

Fabric Blend - 95% Cotton & 5% Elastane Men's Underwear in boxer brief style.

SIZING OPTIONS: 

Waist sizes: 

  • Small (28-30 inches)
  • Medium  (32-34 inches)
  • Large (36-38 inches) 
  • XL (40-42 inches)

SHEATH 2.0's hybrid cotton-elastane fabric is durable, flexible, and stretches both ways so that it can compliment any body type. Whether you have quads that press 600lbs or the build of a daily runner, SHEATH underwear will look amazing on you and feel even more amazing as you journey with them.  

 The SHEATH 2.0 boxer brief is the ideal Underwear for all circumstances. Hand crafted out of 95% cotton for comfort and 5% elastane for increased flexibility, SHEATH holds to your form throughout the day giving you everything you need. SHEATH Underwear are designed to move in unison with your body while gently isolating your MANhood with a pouch sewn on the interior of the garment. With the family jewels in the pouch, they will feel like they are floating on a cloud.

Robert Patton, Founder of SHEATH Underwear was in Iraq when he first had the idea for the SHEATH pocket, but it wasn't until he got home and heard the overwhelming enthusiasm from friends and family towards the idea that he began to pursue this passion for creating a better pair of briefs. Positive feedback from many around him propelled the dream into action, however, in order to turn to turn his dream into reality, Robert needed a team of trusted and passionate individuals. 

The law of attraction brought Robert’s younger brother Matthew Humble into the equation, and after he tried a prototype pair and fell in love with the support and versatility, it was over. Matt coined the name “SHEATH” after he described what it was like wearing them. With his brother Matt, and financial backing cousin, Chris Davalos on the team to help mold the dream, they dedicated themselves to this monumental idea currently being presented to you. Together they found, persistence is the key to success in any endeavour, and it has paid off in creating the ultimate pair of briefs.  

SHEATH Underwear has been in the process of development for a number of years and was introduced into the market last year with it's first successful kickstarter launch. With an initial goal set to $9,000, due to overwhelming support from backers, SHEATH was able to raise over 14K to complete the purchase order. Since then SHEATH has continued to develop the product and has strategically partnered with a new supplier that has exceeded all previous suppliers in terms of quality, professionalism, and efficiency. 


This production launch will be the official game changer for the SHEATH organization.  

We learned how superior quality and customer satisfaction will be our greatest allies. Therefore, by partnering with an elite multinational production company that specializes in Mens ergonomic Underwear and works with successful brands such as Sly, ZUKU, and Elite underwear, just to name a few, we knew we were on the right track. After providing our latest prototypes to the manufacturer, they were intuitively able to reproduce the garments in every size accurately with such precision and quality, we placed an order for 8 thousand pairs.  We are proud to be partnered with a company that focuses on high quality production standards and maintains a less than 1% defect rate.

We thank you so much for your interest in our product and hope we can count on your pledge for this campaign to support an underwear company that designs underwear designed to support you. 

SHEATH-2.0 Strategically Enhanced Performance Briefs.

 

Risks & Challenges

A good faith 40% down payment on our part has already been made. The challenge is to raise the additional 60% to complete production. 

Upon researching the market, we found other underwear Brands manufactured, namely Sly Underwear, who are currently sold in the thousands all over the world, which indicated consistent high quality production by our manufacturer. Due to the quality of production provided, they require higher minimum orders which is why we need your help. We strive to continuously improve our product and meet our customers needs on a daily basis. 

SHEATH-2.0 Strategically Enhanced Performance Briefs

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please try to get the word out and make some noise about our campaign by using the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Think you can crack the encryption? Scroll down to read about our Crypto Challenge.


Impenetrable Cryptography 

We know that it is in the public's best interest for impenetrable security solutions to be widely available. Privacy is a right that is not to be taken lightly and not to be taken away.

Rogue agencies, individuals, and activist groups have overstepped their bounds and we are issuing them a challenge: You will not be able to crack our protocol.

We have developed a patent pending, low latency, streaming encryption protocol that is changing the face of network security and keeps prying eyes away from your network traffic.

Our team is steeped in technology. We bring nearly a century of combined telecommunications, software, networking, and security experience. We hail from Fortune 500 companies, the U.S. Military, government contractors, and startup companies and have decades of higher education behind us. We have successfully led and contributed to multi-million dollar corporate projects involving critical systems with no tolerance for failure.

With our protocol developed and the patent filed, sights are set on embedding the technology into an industrial grade plug-and-play cryptographic device that allows ultra-secure communications between any two points on any IP network, public or private.

If you help us to reach our goal you will enable us to fully bring our protocol to market, allowing it to be licensed for use in any number of devices for use in home, office, government, and industry.

In addition, upon reaching our goal, we will launch a community challenge program, in which we will offer a bounty to several individuals or teams who successfully and uniquely crack the security protocol and show proof of repeatability. The bounty will be 10% of any crowdfunding proceeds, up to a $250,000 bounty and will be cumulative, so if the bounty is not claimed and we start another round of crowdfunding, the bounty will start off at the previously unclaimed amount. See below for details and eligibility info.

What We Need

Our patents have been filed. Now, we need to raise money for a number of things.

  • Meet with more potential clients

  • Research and Development

  • Further testing of our M2M technology at Colorado State University

  • Bring our security protocol and M2M technology to market

  • Design a custom-built, beta security device

  • Integrate our security protocol into our M2M technology

  • File for international patent protection

  • Marketing and Advertising

  • Bring even more quality talent into our team

The Perks!

First off, let's get down to what you get if we don't reach our goal:

You get the perk for the level at which you contributed. It's that simple. We have ensured that we can provide every perk regardless of the amount of funding we get. Here they are:

$2000 - One Pair of No Mount Prototype Cryptos

$3000 - One Pair of Rack Mount Prototype Cryptos

$25,000 - Crypto Installation and Explanation of the Protocol at Your U.S. Location - Includes a Pair of Crypto Devices in Your Choice of Rack Mount or Stand Alone.

The team will Travel to your U.S. location, deliver and install a pair of crypto devices of your choice - no mount or rack mount, and the patent's author will provide an explanation of the technology (with a signed one way NDA). In addition, we will take your team of up to five people out for dinner and further discussion at a four star or better restaurant.

$1 - Our Sincere Thanks for Your Support

$100 - Polo Shirt

$1000 - Reebok Jacket

When we do reach our goal of $20,000, you obviously still get your perks, but in addition, we are then able to launch a community challenge, where those who have contributed enough to receive any of our top three perks are eligible to participate. At this level, we will also award a hoodie to the top grossing referrer. Learn about the challenge below.

Stretch Goals

$50,000 - Upon reaching this goal, we will award a jacket to the top grossing referrer. This goal also brings the challenge pool up to $5000.

$100,000 - Upon reaching this goal, we will award a jacket to the top five referrers instead of just the top one. This also sets the challenge pool to $10,000 and counting.

$250,000 - Upon reaching this stretch goal, we will award one pair of standalone crypto devices to the top grossing referrer, providing that our referral expectations are met. This is also the point at which the challenge pool reaches a value of $25,000 and counting.

What it all Means

Bringing our security protocol to market means that you can protect your IP network even more. Your bank can use it to enhance security between locations and with partners. Your business can keep prying eyes away from proprietary data.

We will also be able to do the R&D needed to fully integrate our security protocol into our M2M technology. Our M2M technology is designed to be used in any industry, including energy, telecommunications, military, government, and transportation to name just a few, so embedding a high level of security is critical. 

Bringing our M2M technology to market with built in security means that it can be used with confidence on electrical grids and other critical infrastructure. Using our technology on electrical grids will allow utility providers to more efficiently balance renewable and non-renewable sources of energy, thus, helping to reduce the amount of waste that is currently experienced. We aim to help make our electrical grids greener, cleaner, and more efficient.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute, you can still help bring the next level of network security. Just spread the word. Talk about our campaign and our technology in security forums, tech forums, even on your favorite geek blog.  Share us the next time you are at a hackerspace or a hackathon. And don't forget to tweet about us, like us on Facebook, and talk about us on LinkedIn.

Crypto Challenge

Offer and Rules

We are presenting a challenge related to our Crypto technology. Anyone who acquires a pair of Crypto devices directly from us will be eligible to join the challenge. This challenge is designed to test and prove-out our cypher technology in a real world installation. As such, the crack should be done in a manner consistent with that scenario. The devices themselves should be considered secure so only decryption of the wire-line data will be considered valid. 

In order to claim a prize, a winner must be able to present their unique crack to us in full detail on a new pair of crypto devices provided by us and prove to us that the process is repeatable by retrieving 128KB (kilobytes) of unknown data. These devices will be on the public Internet and their IP addresses will be provided.

There will be a minimum 30 day waiting period between ship dates for crypto devices awarded in any later crowdfunding efforts. So, for contributors to this campaign, if the last set of cryptos is shipped on December 15th, the first set from a later campaign will not ship before January 14th. This policy will hold true for all subsequent crowdfunding campaigns. In short, this gives current contributors a 30 day head start.

The prize pool will be 10% of any and all money collected through crowdsourcing once a given goal is met. This will be capped at $250,000. The first three to uniquely crack the protocol receive the following percentage of the pool:


1st - 80% of the pool. So if the pool is $100K, $80K would be the prize.

2nd - 10% of the pool.

3rd - 5% of the pool.

If you are not in the top 3, 1% will be awarded until the pool is exhausted. Frankly, we’re not too worried as we’re confident no one will be claiming a prize.

If there are any questions, please reach out at 


*This challenge is around defeating the encryption protocol on the wire.  Compromising, disabling or tampering with the crypto devices themselves to impede, disrupt or stop traffic has no value to this contest unless it's used as part of the wire-line decryption process. That said, as a hint, it's hard for us to see how that's going to help. There will be no direct access to the devices during validation so assuming no access is probably a good starting point.

This goal also brings the challenge pool up to $5000.$100,000 - Upon reaching this goal, we will award a jacket to the top five referrers instead of just the top one. This also sets the challenge pool to $10,000 and counting.$250,000 - Upon reaching this stretch goal, we will award one pair of standalone crypto devices to the top grossing referrer, providing that our referral expectations are met. This is also the point at which the challenge pool reaches a value of $25,000 and counting.What it all MeansBringing our security protocol to market means that you can protect your IP network even more. Your bank can use it to enhance security between locations and with partners. Your business can keep prying eyes away from proprietary data.We will also be able to do the R&D needed to fully integrate our security protocol into our M2M technology. Our M2M technology is designed to be used in any industry, including energy, telecommunications, military, government, and transportation to name just a few, so embedding a high level of security is critical. Bringing our M2M technology to market with built in security means that it can be used with confidence on electrical grids and other critical infrastructure. Using our technology on electrical grids will allow utility providers to more efficiently balance renewable and non-renewable sources of energy, thus, helping to reduce the amount of waste that is currently experienced. We aim to help make our electrical grids greener, cleaner, and more efficient.Other Ways You Can HelpEven if you can't contribute, you can still help bring the next level of network security. Just spread the word. Talk about our campaign and our technology in security forums, tech forums, even on your favorite geek blog.  Share us the next time you are at a hackerspace or a hackathon. And don't forget to tweet about us, like us on Facebook, and talk about us on LinkedIn.Crypto ChallengeOffer and RulesWe are presenting a challenge related to our Crypto technology. Anyone who acquires a pair of Crypto devices directly from us will be eligible to join the challenge. This challenge is designed to test and prove-out our cypher technology in a real world installation. As such, the crack should be done in a manner consistent with that scenario. The devices themselves should be considered secure so only decryption of the wire-line data will be considered valid. In order to claim a prize, a winner must be able to present their unique crack to us in full detail on a new pair of crypto devices provided by us and prove to us that the process is repeatable by retrieving 128KB (kilobytes) of unknown data. These devices will be on the public Internet and their IP addresses will be provided.There will be a minimum 30 day waiting period between ship dates for crypto devices awarded in any later crowdfunding efforts. So, for contributors to this campaign, if the last set of cryptos is shipped on December 15th, the first set from a later campaign will not ship before January 14th. This policy will hold true for all subsequent crowdfunding campaigns. In short, this gives current contributors a 30 day head start.The prize pool will be 10% of any and all money collected through crowdsourcing once a given goal is met. This will be capped at $250,000. The first three to uniquely crack the protocol receive the following percentage of the pool:1st - 80% of the pool. So if the pool is $100K, $80K would be the prize.2nd - 10% of the pool.3rd - 5% of the pool.If you are not in the top 3, 1% will be awarded until the pool is exhausted. Frankly, we’re not too worried as we’re confident no one will be claiming a prize.If there are any questions, please reach out at *This challenge is around defeating the encryption protocol on the wire.  Compromising, disabling or tampering with the crypto devices themselves to impede, disrupt or stop traffic has no value to this contest unless it's used as part of the wire-line decryption process. That said, as a hint, it's hard for us to see how that's going to help. There will be no direct access to the devices during validation so assuming no access is probably a good starting point.

story:
As seen in: 

------------------------------------------

Help VOZ bring its first fully artisan-designed fashion collection to NY Fashion Week!

WE - VOZ - are a fair trade fashion collective using collaborative design to connect rural artisans to global opportunities. VOZ means voice because our designs express the voices of the artisans that create them. We have built VOZ over the last year and a half with indigenous Mapuche women in Southern Chile to become an open platform in which designers and traditional artisans came together to exchange skills, perspectives, and build collections of beautiful clothing.

Help us make this dream come true! 

The success of campaign will allow us to design a full fashion collection that is elegant, original, exciting, professional, and wholly derived from artisans' ideas.  This campaign also enables us to bring this collection to market by launching our designs in New York Fashion Week and Coterie tradeshows next February for Autumn / Winter 2013.

Break down of expenses:

  1. Buy quality materials such as wool, llama, silk, cotton, and natural dyes for our next collection
  2. Pay weavers living wages for prototype development and production
  3. Transportation to bring weavers and designers together, as well as exhibit collection
  4. Maintaining our small studio in rural Chile for 4 months
  5. Exhibiting the collection at a fashion trade show in February, to bridge to more professional sales oppotunities!

Irma Lincoqueo, designer of Poncho Alerce, showing her prototype in our workshop.

Our workshop in Southern Chile is filled with prototypes and drawings, and we need a push of support from the community to buy materials, pay the weavers fair wages to develop the ideas with us, and craft our final pieces. As a fledgling start up, we need help to fully realize our mission of developing artisans' ideas into high fashions - cultivating sustainable education in rural Chile within traditional weaver communities, as well as author credit and design royalties for the artisans who participate.

Marta Isabel Huitraiñan Aillapán, VOZ Co-Founder, showing her prototype. 

Our Impact

VOZ is our hope for a profoundly different design model.  We offer rural design workshops to foster an extraordinary creative dialogue between artisans, designers and the public.

Today many traditional weavers in Latin America struggle to make a living practicing their craft because cheap knockoffs have saturated their local marketplaces. This makes it nearly impossible for rural weavers to sustain themselves by selling their craftwork. Often the pressure is so great that artisans are forced to stop practicing their ancestral art forms.  VOZ now provides materials and fair trade wages to a community of 27 weavers and seamstresses, and can dramatically scale these professional opportunities as we grow.


Margarita Ñanculef Calfín, VOZ Co-Founder, prepares yarn for weaving.

Mainstream fashion design has come to depend on globalized unhealthy production chains that surround us with countless disposable objects.  Mass-produced fashion has disrupted the relationship between maker and wearer. VOZ is committed to reconnecting community via collaborative design. 

At VOZ, our artisan partners proudly protect and cultivate indigenous art forms and techniques, often reviving ancient knowledge about weaves, dyes, and symbols.  We envision a future for fashion, in which ancient wisdom, sexy style, cutting edge innovation, and global problem solving are the elements that compose beautiful clothing.

VOZ weavers dye yarn with plant recipes passed down from generations.

 VOZ is change through beauty, join the movement!

In addition to this Indiegogo campaign, please support our initiative by following us on twitter @madebyvoz, pinterest, friending us on facebook, and shopping our latest collections at www.madebyvoz.com.  Please spread the word about our mission to your family and friends!

About Us

Jasmine, a fine artist and designer, was born and raised in California where she studied product design at Stanford University.  She has dedicated her life’s work to serving community through art and design, including performance arts events, furniture design, graphic design, and fashion. The seeds of VOZ began when Jasmine studied ceremonial design with Q'ero shamans in the Peruvian Highlands in order reconnect product design to craft and cultural story-telling. She partnered with a Chilean NGO the Chol Chol Foundation where she met an incredible community of Mapuche weavers in Southern Chile who had been working over the last thirty years to rescue and develop their ancestral weaving techniques. Jasmine proposed a program for contemporary fashion to compliment their traditional art in order to help them reach new audiences.

Our early prototypes were widely coveted in trade shows in 2010, but we needed to start a business to cull the resources necessary to begin. In 2011 our first successful crowd-funding campaign launched an eight-month design workshop series in Temuco, and we went on to win Start Up Chile and Fundación Chile. This allowed VOZ to train a community of artisans and develop a mini-collection, Fall Winter 2012, which recently hit the shelves for this autumn and is now being carried by eight retailers.  This progress has been wonderful, but we have yet to develop over a hundred prototypes and ideas from our work last year and fulfill our dream of a full fashion collection of 30 clothing pieces and expanded accessories.

Today VOZ is materializing beautifully thanks to the extraordinary team and community that has come together over the last year and half, including Lorena Mardones, Kyra Davis, Karen Ladenheim, Maria Eugenia Maliqueo, Mercedes Montalva, Jess Brown, Irys Kornbluth, Fabian Castro, David Guendelman, Natasha Huang, Justine Massey, Jeannette Valenzuela and Artisan Directors Pascuala del Carmen Leal Vásquez, Irma Lincoqueo, Jacqueline Virginia Valdevenito Monasterio, Julia Torres, Margarita Ñanculef Calfín, Maria Veronica Currivil Nahuel, Marta Isabel Huitraiñan Aillapán, Rosa Isabel Ñanculef Huircapán, Zenobia Currivil Nahuel, Sandy Sandoval, Marcie Valdevenito, Anita Luisa Paillamil Antiqueo, Sonia Catrileo Jaramillo, Ana Currivil, María Huento, María Levil Yevilao, Isabel Currivil, Rosa Mora, Erna Isolina Vallejos, Marisol Adriana Cruces Liempi and Nina Alonso. We’re advised by the most talented people we know, including Bill Burnett, Laura Norris, Sandra Hirschberg, Derek Footer, and Rebecca Rich.  

As close as we are to creating a real high fashion collection - we cannot do it without your support!

Beautiful Rewards!

"Planeta" VOZ Clutch

"Viaje" Exclusive Indiegogo Pouch

(sizes, colors and patterns will vary)

"Ambiente" Scarf Ko

"Ambiente" Scarf Newen

"Eclipse" Shawl Trigo

"Estrella" Dress Anu

Poncho Alerce

Exclusive IndieGoGo gloves! *available in various colors!

Thank you!!

story:
Hi everyone! My name is Lyn Arobo.

I am a 24 year old Filipina and I live on Boracay Island in the Philippines. Boracay is the top tourist destination in the Philippines and the island hosts over one million visitors every year. 

Handcrafted jewelry and designer handbags. 

Boracay's popularity with tourists has spawned a major trading hub for jewelry and handbag designers from all over the philippines to market their custom made products. 

I personally know some of the designers so I can buy handcrafted jewelry and designer handbags direct from the source at rock bottom prices. 

My plan is simple: 

  • To expand the market by creating a website that will allow individuals and retailers, from all over the world, to buy handcrafted jewelry and designer handbags (from the Philippines) at wholesale prices. 

To achieve my plan I need $3,500.00 US dollars. The money will be used to purchase an initial inventory of designer handbags and to create a website. Later I will add handcrafted jewelry to the site.  

Would you agree to help me?

I would sincerely appreciate it if you would agree to help fund my project. Please choose one of the contribution levels shown on the right side of this page and you will receive a credit for a major discount on any of the designer handbags that will be available on June 30th, 2013. 

There is no time limit on the credits so you can either use yours on June 30th, 2013 or you can wait and view future designer handbags I add to my inventory.  

Other ways you can help.

If you have some friends that appreciate designer fashion accessories please use the Indiegogo share tools to tell them about my designer handbag project and to direct them to this page. 

Thank you VERY much viewing my project and considering making a contribution.

Lyn Arobo

story:
Sabrina S. Bradley

As simple as it may seem, I started my career as a fashion designer by watching my mother, hovering over her shoulder while she sewed.  When I was a little girl she had a line of children's clothing she named "Sabrina's Closet," after me, and would spend hours in our living room sewing little jackets out of African prints lined with fluffy quilted fabrics and I would literally just stand and watch. I was fascinated by the bright colors, the noise of the machine, and the scissors she told me I could, "Never use to cut paper!"  And though she never let me touch anything on her table, she could see I was interested and began teaching me the basics:  "Cut out all nessacary pattern pieces," she said. "Line up all pattern pieces so they go against the grain line of the fabric."  "Pin wrong sides together and then sew." I was 6 years old.
 
Eventually I realized what my obsession for fabrics, closures, and styles meant: I had a passion for fashion!  I wanted to know more than how to replace a button or sew a hem, I wanted to design!  I received my BFA in Fashion Design and Marketing and became an expert in sewing, draping, and pattern making.  I became proficient in fashion illustration and learned to use all of the latest graphic technology.  I learned how to be a businesswoman, about how important maintaining an excellent work ethic was and how to be sleepy as hell and still get my work done.   It was my goal to graduate from school and, like my mother, start my own fashion line of, instead of children's clothing,  women's suits, and casual wear. 

The Opportunity 

Since graduation I have been working hard to position myself to reach my goal.  Recently, I have an opportunity to grow my business - BRDLY Apparel, a fashion design and custom sewing company - by participating in a major fashion show: L.A. Fashion Minga on October 18, 2012.  This show not only allows me to show off my great skill as a designer, but will expose my brand and our Spring/Summer line of clothing to 40 department stores/boutiques buyers and several thousand attendees.  It's an opportunity of a lifetime for a "New Bee Designer"

The Goal

This is where you come in.  In order to participate in Fashion Minga I have to raise $4,000 for the entrance fee by Tuesday  September 28,2012.  I am soliciting investors to help me bring my 12 fashionable looks  (12 complete outfits) to the runway of LA Fashion Minga for our big chance to be seen. The contributions go towards:

  • Entrance Fee
  • Photography
  • Videography 
  • Models
  • Hair and Make-up
  • An audience with over 40 department/boutique buys

The Gifts

To show our thanks and appreciation just "THANK YOU!"; will not even show the enthusiaum and gratitude in my heart for you support. There are gifts that for your kindness and generosity: Posters, T-shirts, Customized Garments (exclusivly just for you!) 

There is more than one way you can help!

If you can't contribute monetarily, give us a shout-out on our Facebook http://www.facebook.com/brdlyapparel. Share our campaign and our page with your friends! Word-of-mouth is the highest compliment we can receive so if you appreciate what we've made, tell a friend to tell a friend. We appreciate you even taking the time to look at what we've created, and we will always speak back, personally.

story:
Our Story


We are two friends from Kentucky. In the past year we've developed a fun and flirty line of lingerie and are preparing to share it with the world. Penny Royale stands out because our lingerie uses organic fabrics and is locally made. Our next line of lingerie will incorporate the work of local artist onto our fabrics. Penny Royale's particular style comes from a shared love for all things vintage. The stylings of the 1950s and 1960s are influential in how we cut our underwear-- this retro look is extremely flattering on the female form, especially when we add our own modern touches, which makes our products accessible to any woman. 


The Impact


We are hoping to fill a void for women who want lingerie that is comfortable, creative, and responsible to our environment. Not only will we be impacting our consumers lives by becoming their favorite brand and making you look absolutely adorable--we will be helping to expose developing artists to a broader audience. Our list of talented friends goes on and on and we want to find a way to give something back to them for being so inspiring to us. With each new collection we will work with a different artist and print their artwork onto our products. With each product that is sold we will include printed information about the artist and how our customers can learn more about them. 


What We Need



Fabrics: (organic cotton, elastics, laces, threads, other trims)

$1300

Dyes

$75

Screen Printing Materials (inks, silk screen, frames, misc accesseries)

$210

Labels 

$50

Artist Fund

$900 

Seamstress

$650

Web Site Fees

$800

Packaging 

$115

Promoting(Traveling, Expo Entries, Printing) 

$900

All the expenses listed above are estimates based on the sources of materials we've used thus far. We will be continuing our search for cheaper alternatives that still meet our quality standards. If we do not receive all of our funding needed for our start up we will postpone hiring for website services and seamstress services. We in the past have made all of the lingerie ourselves and we can continue to do so until more funding is available.

What You Get

Hopefully if you decide to donate to Penny Royale you want to own some of our lingerie. And if you donate that is exactly what's going to happen. Depending what level you decide to donate at you will receive either a years subscription which includes a pair of panties each month. Or pajama set which includes our Bandeau Bra. Or art work from our selected artist. Please refer to the side bar for specifics. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us get the word out about our launch. Please post on facebook and other social networking sites. We could use whatever exposer you are willing to help us out with. Gracias, Thank you, Merci.

Love,

   Sarah Jane & Pilar

story:
HOW IT ALL BEGAN
One evening my daughter came back home from an outing with her friends:

"Pa, my friends and I were talking, it's so frustrating every time I go out I have to carry around two pairs of shoes.  Is it possible to invent a shoe that could transform into flats? Here's what I think." I listened to her ideas and thought it's possible. So began our project.

Important Points

  • First Dehappyheels models are reserved specially for Indiegogo backers. This is the first generation (Colombe Gen I).

  • Shoes are delivered to backers with zero cost/or appropriate discount when campaign is successful. Backers eligible for discount are our top priorities. That is why we have included a stand alone manufacturer warranty to be enacted upon final agreement with manufacturer.

  • We will keep finalizing our product until its latter stages to make sure that our backers have the best Colombe Air Shoe aka D2H (DeHappyHeels)

  • The first stage of this campaign is finalizing our prototype. The second stage deals with large scale manufacturing. 


What We Need & What You Get

SUPPORTERS RECEIVE SPECIAL DISCOUNT IN PRODUCTION .

OUR GOAL

We were concerned with elegance and efficiency. Movement had to be limited and swift. The transition had to be as comfortable as possible, to insure better comfort we also worked on the sole.


The Colombe Fashion & Comfort Air Shoe aka DeHappy Heels was designed with great care. It took years tinkering. There were many possibilities. At the end we opted for the best mechanism: clean and simple. The invention comprised of combination of soles, a heel mechanism with an optional variant. The Shoe is designed with flexible components.

Wear it erect for your special occasions and the heel will remain sturdy as your classical high heels, or wear it is a flat. This is possible because our patent pending mechanism has a revolutionary system that allows lock in core. In either positions. Once you decide to walk more comfortably the shoe will transform to a flat shoe position. The entire apparatus becomes alive with the simple push of a button. We can achieve this because we have designed DeHappy Heels to follow the humans natural foot dynamic. We have not forced the mechanism onto the foot. We have adapted the shoe to the foot. It is here that we depart from ancient systems. We have allied elegance and functionality while respecting the natural dynamics of the foot.

We have always been concerned with the problems posed by high heeled shoe pains; with our patent pending solution we have largely solved this issue. By studying the foot and finding better ergonomic as well as mechanical solutions. We covered everything: heels, sole, arc, toes, ledger, flesh and bones. We created a shoe where women could be elegant in their heels as well as enjoy the benefit of sneaker like integration. It was out of the question for women to pull out their heels or to resolve in so called collapsible schemes. We wanted a clean and simple solution. A smooth system, one that was elegant, comfortable, healthy and efficient.


It’s a discreet machine in itself. Yet it is light, invisible, smooth, effective and sturdy. In order to reach this goal we went through loads and loads of material. We inspected large number of shoes. Considered all kind of heel's their height, forms and dimensions. Did it have to be big, small, could it still be elegant? Yes, yes and yes. We could get all of that done. We could create a collapsible heel that will not be removable. A heel that will change from one position to another at the push of a button. And it could be elegant too!

Then we had to consider the right material. Leather? Rubber? Plastic? How about the heel? Will it be made of wood then covered with leather like classical model? Perhaps new type of hard rubber? After sweating over this issue for a while we discovered elastic leather that were strong, elegant, fashionable and most importantly were already tested by manufacturers for years. There are also synthetic materials getting better and better everyday. The shoe indeed has to be flexible. The heel inside mechanism was another story. It had to be efficient and simple. For that is the mark of all great things. As for inner material? We have thus far settle for titanium. It is strong, and light.


Owing to the best available material DeHappy Heels is set to be just right for its purpose. Special soles follows foot physiology to the detail. Our revolutionary design  gives to the foot smooth repository while adjusting to weight. This creates an even distribution of sensibility that varies from toes to heel as nature wants it. The result is a comfortable experience both in the shoes high heel position as well as in its flat shoe position.


DeHappy Heels(Colombe Air Shoe for Women) deposited in the US patent office 2013

Thank You for your support!

The Platform Supporters! Receive a 24k gold iPad!

                  


Father & Daughter Inventors Alexis & Maxime Feyou de Happy

SPECIALLY DESIGNED FOR  OUR SUPPORTERS:

Golden Heels Classic Wall Clocks 



Tweetie T's for Dehappyheels 





DEHAPPYHEELS (D2H) AND THE COMPETITION


Dehappyheels Mugs!

SPECIALLY DESIGNED FOR  OUR SUPPORTERS:



THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT !

    MORE FOR OUR SUPPORTERS: Mobile cases of your choice!

    Original designs!

  • Mobile cases: (iPhone and iPod) designed by Dehappyheels co-inventor for our supporters. Comes in: black, white, red, pink and blue.

Of course you also get the Dehappyheels first production pair of shoes!

Other Ways You Can Help

FOR SHOE MANUFACTURERS

We are working on an independent apparatus that will allow shoe manufacturer to adapt the heel mechanism to their existing shoes without having to reinvent the wheel. Thanks to modern technology we can reduce the patent pending mechanism to very small size therefore making it adaptable to all kind of designs. A new sole combination is unavoidable. Therefore with the newly refined heel mechanism we are also working on subtlety without the sole itself.

The Ultimate Gift!


ABOUT OUR PROJECT

Our goal is to create first samples within the next six months. Our Chief engineer for this project will assist manufacturers as desired during the first production cycle. To obtain a product of great quality we are prepared to give it our best. Conscious of the great challenge presented by this project we have minutely reviewed all aspects of our invention. We intend to continue on this road as needed.

FAQ


This sounds like a therapeutic shoes. Will it be available to the larger public?

First of all it is designed for the comfort of the foot. Hence its purported therapeutic purpose. But D2H had no such ambition. Our goal simply attempted to make high heels more comfortable. Our dream is to make it available to the larger public.

Do this shoes comes in all sizes?

The goal of our campaign is to make shoes of all standard sizes.

Are these heavy shoes?

-No! We went out of our way to make sure that the mechanism was light enough. We intend to continue researching new materials out there to keep them as light as possible.

How do you know that the mechanism will not be affected by body weight?

-This was another big concern of ours. This is why we also reinvented the sole. We have created an insulating system that keeps the mechanism away from the foot. You'll never know that it is down there.

When are we going to have it?

- We have already began searching for manufacturers worldwide. Once we secure an agreement and begin production the entire process should take about six month from the end of our project. Most perks will be sent within the first three months following the end of our campaign. The shoe itself will be received later on because we will have to fine tune it with manufacturers.

Center. Maxime's mother  in Paris, c.1961 standing with Yves Saint Laurent (Christian Dior's period 1960-1964)

TO OUR MOTHER AND GRANDMOTHER

We have dedicated this campaign to Lady T. Alphonsine Feyou de Happy of Pumbo, Cameroon. In the sixties she interrupted a great period of her life (Haute Couture and Cordon Bleue studies), working with such great name as  Yves Saint Laurent in Paris. Her second son,was in coma after a car accident. She returned to Cameroon.

Back home, she trained many young women. Some of her graduates followed her footsteps to France.

Thank you,
     The DeHappy Heels team

story:
BADSPADE sunglasses are eco-friendly, super lightweight bamboo sunglasses.

BADSPADE Eyewear is inspired by nature, musicians, artists, philosophers, and dreamers. We want BADSPADE to stand for something bigger than just sunglasses. It represents a beauty and lifestyle we’ve learned from a love of nature and from the people that have touched our lives. The BADSPADE ideal is etched onto every pair of sunglasses “HODIERNUM VIVE DIEM” meaning " live for today". Right now is the only moment we have.

Stay in this moment and Live for Today."

BADSPADE sunglasses connect you to the natural energy in nature in a way that is stylish, sexy, and sustainable by providing sunglasses made with natural exotic woods. Our sunglasses are embodied with the spirit of nature and the soul of the trees they are carved from. All of our frames contain bamboo to make them float.

BADSPADE Marley's are made of solid bamboo and have a luxurious flat black finish, and the best part is they float on water. If you enjoy water sports, Fishing, or just going to the beach and have ever lost a pair shades then you know how amazing this is. Make the Marley's your new favorite shades and never lose them to the water again! Named in honor of the late great Bob Marley, the Marley's are made with high quality stainless steel spring hinges to give you a comfortable secure fit. The Marley's also feature polarized lenses and are prescription ready. Frame Size: 44-14-140.

  • Prescription Ready!!
  • THEY FLOAT ON WATER!!!
  • 100% UAV/UVB protection & polarized lenses
  • Stainless steel spring hinges
  • Engraved "HODIERNUM VIVE DIEM" - Live For Today
  • Hard case & microfiber cloth included.

FAQ

I have a question or I want to drop you a line, how do I contact you?
Drop us a line anytime: sales@badspade.com

Where is the money going?
All funds are going right towards the production run of our sunglasses and to get BADSPADE off the ground and up and running. The funds generated from this campaign will also go to purchase hard cases, shipping boxes, and pay for product photoshoots and marketing materials. We genuinely thank you for your support. 

When will my BADSPADE Frames be delivered?
Keep in mind, these are handcrafted. We are working hard to ensure quality, and style are second to none. These shades are made from Bamboo, we have about 40 pair currently in stock. The first 40 will get them ASAP. Once those 40 are gone we will have to produce more and they will be ready in about 60 Days. Don’t fret, of course they’ll arrive before summer.  We want you all looking good at the beach.

Is there a warranty for BADSPADE Eyewear?
Absolutely, we've got you covered. Customer satisfaction is our #1 Priority so we have got you covered. Your shades are covered for Life! There is a lifetime guarantee against manufacturer's defects on all sunglasses. If something is to ever happen to your shades, send your sunnies with proof of purchase and we will replace them and ship you a new pair no questions asked. You must provide proof of purchase along with sunnies for any warranty claim.

Are BADSPADE sunglasses polarized?
YES!! Your eyes are very important. Our entire line features 100% UVA/UVB protectant, polarized lenses.

Are BADSPADE Prescription Ready?
YES!! The Marley Bamboo sunglasses are ready to take prescription lenses.

Is BADSPADE Eyewear available in retail stores?
 YES!! But we are always looking to expand into new areas. If you know a store that should carry these awesome shades drop us a line at sales@badspade.com and visit our website for store locations and details www.BADSPADE.com.

Do you ship internationally?
YES!! for this campaign International shipping add $15.

THANKS YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!!!
 We could not do this without you! We appreciate all of your support.
Please spread the word via social media.

Facebook    www.facebook.com/BADSPADE

Twitter         www.twitter.com/BADSPADE

Instagram    www.hashgr.am/u/BADSPADE

Once again, we thank you! We will keep you all posted as this campaign grows with updates, videos, and more perks...

story:
Hi,

My name is Darian Jerard Bagley and I have a unique clothing idea that I want to get into every department store in America and around the world.

I'm not your normal clothing designer.  In fact, God has placed many ideas in my head over the years and I'm attempting to bring this one to life.  I'm actually a TV and Film producer by trade and have been so for over 20 years.

I've worked for the most part in the Philadelphia area producing local content/stories for FOX-TV, NBC 10, PBS-WHYY TV 12, and I even won 2 Emmy's in 1996 for "The Sounds of Phildelphia".  I've also worked for Mr. Bill Cosby on his Philadelphia production of "You Bet Your Life".

I'm reaching out to the Indiegogo community because I have a great clothing idea that I've been selling at Flea Markets, Craft shows and Door-To-Door but would like to see it in every department store in America.  

I am motivated by the positive support and response I have received about this product over the years and support from Indiegogo will allow me to:

     1. Create an Inventory

     2. Build a great interactive Website

     3. Participate in Clothing Trade shows around the world

     4. Develop the packaging and a Department store display 

     5. Produce a TV commercial to air nationally

If the goal of $10,000 isn't reached, the money that is raised will go directly to creating an inventory, marketing and building the website so that we can continue to raise money to move forward with the other goals.  The main purpose is to become a shining example of how to follow thru with your dreams no matter how long or hard the journey is.  

Not only is "SCHAT" a totally original design, but it takes an old idea and transforms it into a newer product that has multiple uses.  It will also serve as an example of that old saying that "No idea is a bad idea, and dreams can come true if you work hard and believe in yourself."

Support from the Indiegogo community could literally change and save the lives of many by simply becoming the blueprint of how to move forward with your ideas.
